title: Former President Harry S. Truman, Maj. General Louis W. Truman and others at Fort Lewis, Washington
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman and Maj. General Louis W. Truman (on Truman's left), Truman's 2nd cousin, pose with a group of unidentified state dignitaries and staff officers of the 4th Infantry Division during the former President's visit to Fort Lewis, Washington.  Mr. Truman was in Seattle, Washington, to attend the Democratic party's annual Jefferson-Jackson Day Banquet.  From:  Major General Louis W. Truman.

title: James F. Twohy, Governor Thomas E. Dewey and others at a National Conference of Christians and Jews banquet in New York  City
Scopenote: Seated at the dinner table are, left to right:  Father John La Farge, Arthur Compton, James F. Twohy (Co-Chairman), Governor Thomas E. Dewey, and Chief Justice Earl Warren.  The event was a National Conference of Christians and Jews banquet in New York City at which a portrait of Chief Justice Charles Evan Hughes was unveiled.
Institutional Creator: Irving Kaufman Studios, New York, NY

title: Former President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with A1C Gerald L. Ingram, Airman of the Year, at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (second from left) shakes hands with Airman First Class Gerald L. Ingram, each holding on to the Certificate naming Ingram as Airman of the Year for 1963 at Richards-Gebaur Air Base (in Belton, Missouri), as Mrs. Beverly Ingram and an unidentified man look on.  The Ingram's and their party met with the former President at the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, and were taken on a tour by Milton Perry, Curator.  From:  Col. John A. Riffle.

title: Captured German Cars from World War I
Scopenote: Captured German cars used for officers on road.  From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: James F. Twohy, National Conference of Christians and Jews, shows Robert D. Murphy a picture of the Founders
Scopenote: James F. Twohy (left) of Santa Clara, California, regent and lecturer in political science at the University of Santa Clara, turns over his post as national Catholic co-chairman of the National Conference of Christians and Jews in New York to Robert D. Murphy, former Undersecretary of State. Twohy, although retiring from the national post, will continue to serve as Catholic co-chairman emeritus. Twohy is pointing to a picture which shows the three founders of the conference, Carlton J.H. Hayes, Robert W. Straus, and Newton D. Baker. James F. Twohy is also Governor of the Federal Home Loan Bank Administration.

title: Battery C "Back from France"
Scopenote: A group photograph of Battery C, 35th Division, "Back from France."  They are at Camp Mills, New York. Photo is tattered and creased. Original photograph is in oversize file.  From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Officers of the 129th Field Artillery, including Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Officers of the 129th Field Artillery back from France, in Camp Mills, New York.  Harry S. Truman is seated second from left. Photo is tattered and creased.  Original photograph is in oversize file.  From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Overview of the breakfast for President Truman by Battery D on Inauguration morning
Scopenote: Overview of the breakfast for President Harry S. Truman by his comrades from Battery D at the Mayflower Hotel on Inauguration morning. President Truman is at back table.  Original photograph is filed in the oversize file.  From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Former President Truman Receives Plaque from Col. Riffle at the Truman Library
Scopenote: At the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, former President Harry S. Truman (center) holds a plaque from the U.S. Air Force Academy presented to him by an unidentified man. On Mr. Truman's left is Air Force Reserve Colonel John A. Riffle. The plaque reads: "In grateful recognition of his consistent efforts to persuade the nation's youth to public service." The photo is autographed as follows: "Kind regards to Col. John A. Riffle from Harry S. Truman 9/1/6(illegible). (See also 95-359.) Donor: Colonel John A. Riffle.

title: Former President Truman in a Three-Way Handshake with Two Men at the Truman Library
Scopenote: At the Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, former President Harry S. Truman clasps hands with an unidentified man and an unidentified Air Force officer.  The occasion is the presentation of a plaque from the U.S. Air Force Academy to the former President which reads:  "In grateful recognition of his consistent efforts to persuade the nation's youth to public service."  (See also 2007-128 and 95-359.)  Donor:  Colonel John A. Riffle.

title: Informal portrait of Franklin D. Roosevelt
Scopenote: Informal portrait of Franklin D. Roosevelt sitting in a yacht enjoying the ocean air.  He is smoking a cigarette and sporting sunglasses.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with an unidentified man at the Truman Library
Scopenote: At the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, former President Harry S. Truman (right) shakes hands with an unidentified man.  The occasion is the presentation of a plaque from the U.S. Air Force Academy to the former President which reads:  "In grateful recognition of his consistent efforts to persuade the nation's youth to public service."  (See also 2007-128 and 95-359.)  From:  Colonel John A. Riffle.

title: Former President Truman, Col. John Riffle and an unidentified officer at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman meets with Air Force Reserve Colonel John A. Riffle (center) and an unidentified officer (right) in Mr. Truman's office at the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri.    Donor:  Colonel John A. Riffle.

title: Former President Truman at a Luncheon at Richards-Gebaur Air Force Base
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman enjoys a luncheon with officers and civilians at Richards-Gebaur Air Force Base, Missouri.  At the podium is Air Force Reserve Colonel John A. Riffle.  The others are unidentified, as are the event and date.  Donor:  Colonel John A. Riffle.

title: Former President Truman at a Luncheon at Richards-Gebaur Air Force Base
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman stands and gives an informal speech at a luncheon with officers and civilians at Richards-Gebaur Air Force Base, Grandview, Missouri. Behind, at the podium, is Air Force Reserve Colonel John A. Riffle. The others are unidentified. Donor: Colonel John A. Riffle

title: Former President Harry S. Truman, Mayor H. Roe Bartle, Col. John A. Riffle and Others at a Luncheon
Scopenote: Sitting at the lunch table, former President Harry S. Truman (third from left)listens to an "after-lunch" speech given by Reserve Air Force Colonel John A. Riffle standing at the podium.  Kansas City Mayor H. Roe Bartle is on the left.  The other two are unidentified. The photo is autographed (copy) as follows:  "To Colonel John Riffle, Kindest regards, from Harry S. Truman 2-7-64."  Donor:  Colonel John A. Riffle.

title: Former President Truman and Reserve Air Force Colonel John A. Riffle in Truman's office at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with Reserve Air Force Colonel John A. Riffle standing by the globe in Truman's office during a visit to the Truman Library in Independence, Missouri.   Donor:  Colonel John A. Riffle.

title: Former President Truman and Col. John A. Riffle in Truman's office at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Sitting at his desk in his office at the Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, former President Harry S. Truman autographs a copy of his book "Years of Trial and Hope" for his friend, Reserve Air Force Colonel John A. Riffle.  Donor:  Colonel John A. Riffle.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman and Rufus Burrus at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman receives what appear to be sound recordings and a handshake from Col. Rufus Burrus during his visit to the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri.  From:  Col. John A. Riffle.

title: Former President Truman at the podium at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman stands at the podium on the auditorium stage at the Truman Library in Independence, Missouri.  (See also 2007-139.)  Donor:  Col. John A. Riffle.

title: Former President Truman and Col. John A. Riffle at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman stands behind the podium on the auditorium stage at the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, and chats with Col. John A. Riffle (at left).  Donor:  Col. John A. Riffle.

title: Former President Truman and employees of a Studebaker dealership at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman poses in front of a new Studebaker Avanti with the owner and employees of a Studebaker dealership in the circle drive near the North entrance of the Truman Library.  Left to right are:  Ken Travis, Harry Chill, Fred D. Whitaker, Mr. Truman, Bob Johnson, and Tom Meyers.  From:  Fred D. Whitaker.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman, Col. John A. Riffle and Unidentified Air Force Officers
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (second from left) signs an unidentified document while seated in a lounge with Air Force Col. John A. Riffle (right) and two other unidentified Air Force officers.    Donor:  Col. John A. Riffle.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley
Scopenote: Portrait of President Harry S. Truman (left) and Vice President Alben Barkley seated on a bench at the White House. Donor: Col. John A. Riffle.

title: View of the speakers' platform at groundbreaking ceremonies for the Truman Library
Scopenote: A view of the speakers' platform at groundbreaking ceremonies for the $1,750,000 Harry S. Truman Library to be erected at Slover Park on grounds donated by the City of Independence, Missouri.  Of those who can be identified are architect Alonzo Gentry (left foreground) and Margaret Truman (center).  (See also 59-576.)  From:  Truman Library Dedication folder

title: View of the Speakers' Platform at Groundbreaking ceremonies for the Truman Library
Scopenote: A view of the speakers' platform at groundbreaking ceremonies for the $1,750,000 Truman Library to be erected at Slover Park on grounds donated by the City of Independence, Missouri.  Margaret Truman can be seen on the left.  (See also 59-576 and 2007-142.)  From:  Truman Library Dedication.

title: Basil O'Connor speaking at Groundbreaking Ceremonies for the Truman Library
Scopenote: Basil O'Connor, Chairman of the Executive Committee for the Harry Truman Memorial Library, stands at the podium and addresses the crowd at groundbreaking ceremonies for the $1,750,000 Truman Library to be erected at Slover Park on grounds donated by the City of Independence, Missouri.  (See also 94-209.) (Slightly smaller version of 59-577)  From:  Truman Library Dedication.

title: Robert T. Weatherford addressing the crowd at the Truman Library groundbreaking
Scopenote: Robert T. Weatherford, Mayor of Independence, Missouri, at the podium on the speakers' platform addresses the crowd gathered for groundbreaking ceremonies for the $1,750,000 Truman Library to be erected at Slover Park on grounds donated by the City of Independence, Missouri.  (Cropped version of 59-579)  From:  Truman Library Dedication.

title: A view of the speakers' platform at groundbreaking ceremonies for the Truman Library
Scopenote: A view of the speakers' platform at groundbreaking ceremonies for the $1,750,000 Harry S. Truman Library to be erected at Slover Park, on grounds donated by the City of Independence, Missouri.  Of those who can be identified is Margaret Truman (background, left).  (See also 59-576 and 2007-142 and 143.)  From:  Truman Library Dedication.

title: Chief Justice Earl Warren speaks at the dedication of the Truman Library
Scopenote: Standing on the speakers' platform set up in front of the new Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, Supreme Court Chief Justice Earl Warren is shown giving the principal address at the dedication ceremonies.  From:  Truman Library Dedication.

title: Georgia Neese Clark, India Edwards, Robert Weatherford, and Herbert Hoover at the Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: Standing before a row of chairs set up in front of the new Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, a group of dignitaries gathers for the dedication ceremonies.  Right to left are:  Georgia Neece Clark Gray, India Edwards, Independence Mayor Robert Weatherford, and former President Herbert Hoover.  The others are unidentified.  From:  Truman Library Dedication

title: India Edwards, Robert Weatherford, and Herbert Hoover at the Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: Standing before a row of chairs set up in front of the new Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, a group of dignitaries gathers for the dedication ceremonies.  Right to left are:  India Edwards (former head of the Democratic Women's Committee), Independence Mayor Robert Weatherford, and former President Herbert Hoover.  The others are unidentified.  From:  Truman Library Dedication.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman and Fred D. Whitaker in front of a Studebaker automobile at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman shares a joke with Fred D. Whitaker, owner of a Studebaker dealership, as Mr. Whitaker exits a new, 1962 Studebaker Avanti automobile parked in the circle drive near the north entrance to the Harry S. Truman Library.  Donor:  Fred D. Whitaker.

title: Bess Truman, Eleanor Roosevelt, and Basil O'Connor at Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: Standing in a reserved seating area in front of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, are distinguished visitors to the dedication ceremonies.  Left to right are:  Basil O'Connor,  president of the organization that raised funds for the new Library; Eleanor Roosevelt; and Bess Truman.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman, John Snyder, and Monsignor Tiernan at the Truman Home
Scopenote: Standing in the backyard of Mr. Truman's home at 219 N. Delaware in Independence, Missouri, with drink in hand, former Secretary of Treasury John Snyder (center) speaks with former President Harry S. Truman and former European Theater Chaplain, Monsignor L. Curtis Tiernan (left). The men are relaxing after attending dedication ceremonies for the new Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri. From: Truman Library Dedication.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman at his Home after Truman Library Dedication
Scopenote: Standing outdoors under the trees at is home at 219 N. Delaware, Independence, Missouri, former President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with an unidentified man after attending dedication ceremonies for the new Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri.  Unidentified man at left.  From:  Truman Library Dedication.

title: Mary Ethel Noland in her senior years
Scopenote: Mary Ethel Noland in her senior years, cousin of former President Harry S. Truman, is escorted into a room where possibly lunch or dinner is being served.  The date, event, location and others in the photo are unknown.  From:  Clem Bangers

title: President Harry S. Truman and others on the rear platform of a train in San Marcos, Texas
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaks from the rear platform of a train at a whistlestop in San Marcos, Texas, during the 1948 presidential campaign.  Left to right are:  Ed Geisen, a local politician; Lyndon B. Johnson (partially obscured); President Harry S. Truman; Ed Cape, a banker; Laura Ramsay; and Judge Max Smith, a local County Judge.  From:  Charles Blankenship.

title: President Harry S. Truman at a motor stop in New Albany, Indiana
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands in the back seat of an automobile greeting residents at a motor stop in front of a used-car lot in New Albany, Indiana.  At left is Sheriff Alex Watkins.  The boy in the background is Thomas E. Borden, Sr.    From:  Thomas E. Borden, Sr.

title: Former Presidents Truman and Eisenhower before a luncheon sponsored by U.N. organization We Believe
Scopenote: Former Presidents Harry S. Truman and Dwight D. Eisenhower (left) converse with unidentified reporters and dignitaries gathered for a lunch in honor of the United Nations Organization "We Believe."  The U.N. symbol hangs on the wall behind the two former presidents.  The luncheon is in Kansas City, Missouri.  (See also 70-852.)  From:  Bob Boothman

title: Former Presidents Harry S. Truman and Eisenhower before a United Nations We Believe Luncheon
Scopenote: Former Presidents Harry S. Truman (second from left) and Dwight D. Eisenhower (left) converse with unidentified reporters and dignitaries gathered for a lunch in honor of the United Nations Organization "We  Believe."  The U.N. symbol hangs on the wall behind the two former presidents.  The luncheon is in Kansas City, Missouri.  (See also 70-852.)  From:  Bob Boothman.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman watches the balloting at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, backer of New York Governor Averell Harriman, watches the scoreboard behind the rostrum at the balloting session of the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, Illinois, as 598 votes for Adlai Stevenson are registered. Pennsylvania gave Stevenson 67 votes to 7 for Harriman at 9:56 P.M. That put Stevenson over. A tremendous cheer went up from the crowd. Mr. Truman sat grinning and talking to those around him in his front-row seat. Stevenson is the Democratic Presidential nominee, having won a smashing first-ballot victory. From: John E. Boos. 21 Dudley Heights, Albany, New York 12210

title: Secretary of Labor Lewis B. Schwellenbach Speaks at a Labor Convention in San Francisco, California
Scopenote: High profits cause high prices, says Labor Secretary Lewis B. Schwellenbach.  Speaking before the Federation of Labor convention at San Francisco, California, Schwellenbach sounds his "A" in the nationwide argument over the cause of inflation; his charge is that industry's large profits, and not workers' wage increases, are causing high prices.  From:  John E. Boos.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman in a 3-way handshake with Bob Johnson and Tom Meyers at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center)poses for a three-way handshake with Bob Johnson and Tom Meyers, employees at a Studebaker dealership, in the circle drive near the north entrance to the Truman Library.  In the background is a new, 1962 Studebaker Avanti automobile.  From:  Fred D. Whitaker.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Bess and Margaret Truman at the voting booth
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, holding his ballot, steps out of the voting booth at the Memorial Building, voting place of the 7th Precinct of Blue Township in Independence, Missouri.  In adjoining voting booths casting ballots in the general election are Bess Truman (left) and Margaret Truman (center).  (See also 77-3559.)  From:  John E. Boos.

title: Front lobby of the Truman Library, Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: View of the main lobby of the Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, looking outward through the glass doors toward the flag.  From:  John T. Boysen, Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City, Kansas City 6, Missouri

title: Former President Truman, Harold H. Boxer and Rabbi Abraham Danzig in Truman's office at the Federal Reserve Bank Building
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman meets with Harold H. Boxer (right), a member of the Union of Orthodox Jewish Congregations of America, and Rabbi Abraham Danzig (left) in his office at the Federal Reserve Bank Building, Kansas City, Missouri.  The photo bears the words "Harold H. Boxer Aug 6,56", but the writing cannot be authenticated as a signature.  From:  Harold H. Boxer, Union of Orthodox Jewish Congregations of America, New York, New York.
Institutional Creator: Montgomery Foto Service, Kansas City, MO

title: Margaret Truman and three high school reporters in Berwick, Pennsylvania before a concert
Scopenote: Margaret Truman is shown as she appeared before her concert given in Berwick High School, in Berwick, Pennsylvania.  The picture was taken in Hotel Berwick in 1953 with Christine H. Bower (left), Social Editor of the Berwick Enterprise, along with three high school reporters (left to right), Carole J. Hampel, Madelyn Bond (Miller), and Janet Fink.  From:  Mrs. Howard L. Bower

title: President Harry S. Truman in a motorcade in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waves from the back seat of an automobile while riding in a motorcade upon his arrival in Key West, Florida, after the 1948 election.  (See also 77-697 and 65-2317.)  From:  Richard Bower

title: President Harry S. Truman and reporters in Key West, Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center)chats informally with White House photographers and reporters on the grounds of the Little White House in Key West, Florida.  The three in the background on the left are (left to right) Bill Gerecke, Charles Protz, and Harry Walsh.  On the President's right is Jeff Brodhead.  On Truman's left, with his back turned, is Press Secretary Charles Ross.  In front of Ross, left to right, are Alfonso Muto, M.H. Posey, Harvey George, and an unidentified man.  (See also 66-874.)  From:  Richard Bower.

title: President Franklin D. Roosevelt and his son James
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt, with son James at his side, waves to a crowd of admirers.  The event, location, and other people in the photo are unknown, though it appears to be a political rally.  From:  John Bosworth.

title: Governor Franklin D. Roosevelt and Others in an Observation Tower
Scopenote: Mr. "Smith" points out a sight to Governor Franklin D. Roosevelt from an observation tower.  The event, location, and identities of others in the photo are unknown.  From:  John Bosworth.

title: Margaret Truman and New Jersey Governor Meyner at a Yale-Princeton football game
Scopenote: Sporting the requisite chrysanthemum, Margaret Truman sits on the 50-yard line with New Jersey Governor Robert B. Meyner at a Yale-Princeton football game in Princeton, New Jersey.  (See also 94-301.)  From:  John Bosworth

title: Portrait of Margaret Truman on a ship
Scopenote: Portrait of Margaret Truman in a dark suit,  leaning on the railing of a ship.  The event, location, and date are unknown.  From:  John Bosworth

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Autographs his Book at the Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman autographs a copy of his book on top of a new, 1962 Studebaker Avanti automobile, for an employee of a Studebaker dealership.  The car is parked in the circle drive near the north entrance of the Truman Library.  The two men with backs turned are unidentified.  The man on the left is Tom Meyers.  From:  Fred D. Whitaker.

title: Head and shoulders picture of Margaret Truman in evening dress
Scopenote: Portrait of Margaret Truman in sparkling jewelry and fur on her way to a gala evening.  Others in the photo are unknown, as are the location, date and event.  From:  John Bosworth

title: A laughing Margaret Truman in black dress and pearls
Scopenote: Portrait of a smiling Margaret Truman in black dress with hands held high as if directing an orchestra.  Unidentified man at left.  From:  John Bosworth

title: Portrait of Margaret Truman reading a document
Scopenote: Portrait of Margaret Truman, with hand on her face, reading a document.  From:  John Bosworth

title: Margaret Truman at an interview
Scopenote: Margaret Truman giving an interview.  The two reporters are unidentified, and the date, location and event are unknown.  From:  John Bosworth

title: Informal portrait of Margaret Truman Daniel and Clifton Daniel
Scopenote: Informal portrait of Clifton Daniel and Margaret Truman Daniel sitting on a sofa.  The event, location and date are unknown.  From:  John Bosworth

title: President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman and Margaret Truman being interviewed by a census taker at Key West
Scopenote: The First Family is being interviewed and "counted" on the grounds of the Little White House at Key West, Florida, by Census Enumerator, Mrs. Eileen M. Nolte, wife of a Navy Warrant Officer aboard the USS Gilmore. Left to right are:  Mrs. Nolte, Bess Truman, President Truman, and Margaret Truman.  (See also 66-875, 64-448, 67-2638 thru 2642, 75-363 and 92-222.)  From:  John Bosworth

title: President Harry S. Truman Speaks at the Flag Raising Ceremonies in Berlin, Germany
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman speaks at ceremonies held at the United States Group Control Council Headquarters during the first official raising of the United States flag over the headquarters.  On the left is General George Patton and General Dwight Eisenhower (second from left). The flag used was the same one that had flown over the Capitol in Washington when war was declared against Germany and since has flown over Casablanca, Algiers, and Rome.  (This photo is a part of a larger photo, 66-3450.) President Truman is in Germany for the Potsdam Conference.  From:  Solomon Bogard.
Institutional Creator: Keystone Press Agency Limited, London, England

title: President Harry S. Truman Steps Down from a Car to Attend Flag Raising Ceremonies in Berlin, Germany
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman steps down from his car after arriving in Berlin, Germany, for flag raising ceremonies.  The flag (Flag of Liberation), which flew over the Capitol in Washington, D.C., when America entered the war, will be hoisted over the headquarters of the U.S. Group Control Council, the former headquarters of the Luftwaffe District Comm.  The same flag was raised in Rome and is destined to fly over Tokyo.  General Patton (back to camera) is saluting the President.  The others are unidentified.  (See also 66-3441.) President Truman is in Germany for the Potsdam Conference.  From:  Solomon Bogard.

title: President Harry S. Truman Salutes the Flag at Ceremonies in Berlin, Germany
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and others salute the flag (Flag of Liberation)in Berlin, Germany, where he will speak at flag raising ceremonies.  The flag which flew over the Capitol in Washington, D.C., when America entered the war will be hoisted over the headquarters of the U.S. Group Control Council, the former headquarters of the Luftwaffe.  The same flag was raised in Rome and is destined to fly over Tokyo.  On Truman's right are Generals Patton and Eisenhower. (See also 2007-277 and 66-3441.) President Truman is in Germany for the Potsdam Conference.  From:  Solomon Bogard.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman autographs a book for Fred D. Whitaker at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman autographs his book on the top of a new, 1962 Studebaker Avanti automobile parked in the Circle Drive near the north entrance of the Harry S. Truman Library.  Watching him are visitors from the Studebaker dealership.  Left to right are:  Bob Johnson, Ken Travis, Tom Meyers (behind Truman), Fred D. Whitaker, and Harry Chill.  From:  Fred D. Whitaker.

title: President Harry S. Truman exercises on the deck of the USS Missouri during his trip to Brazil
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman takes the role of coach as he leads the Truman Athletic Club in exercises on the deck of the U.S.S. Missouri.  The club, formed by newsmen who are covering the presidential trip to Brazil, presented the President with a "T" shirt with six stars on the sleeves.      From:  Bjorn Bjornson.

title: President Harry S. Truman at a special news conference at Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada
Scopenote: Left to right:  Canada's Prime Minister Mackenzie King, President Harry S. Truman, and  the Chief of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, waiting to speak at a press conference held on the lawn of the Seignory Club at Monte-Bello, Ontario.  The President is in Canada on a three-day trip where he addressed a joint session of the Canadian Senate and Parliament at Ottawa.  Standing directly behind the President is Ray Atherton, U.S. Ambassador to Canada.  Standing on the left is Charles Ross, the President's Press Secretary.  (See also 65-581 through 606.)  From:  Bjorn Bjornson.

title: President Harry S. Truman at a special news conference at Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada
Scopenote: Surrounded by photographers and reporters, President Harry S. Truman (center) holds a special news conference on the lawn of the Seignory Club at Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada. At right is U.S. Ambassador to Canada, Ray Atherton, and on the left is the Chief of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. The others are unidentified. The President is in Canada on a three-day trip during which he addressed a joint session of the Canadian Senate and Parliament. (See also 65-581 thru 606.) From: Bjorn Bjornson.

title: President Harry S. Truman at a special news conference at Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada
Scopenote: Surrounded by photographers and reporters, President Harry S. Truman (center) holds a special news conference on the lawn of the Seignory Club at Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada.  At right is U.S. Ambassador to Canada, Ray Atherton.  The President is in Canada on a three-day trip during which he addressed a joint session of the Canadian Senate and Parliament.  (See also 65-581 thru 606.)  From:  Bjorn Bjornson.

title: President Harry S. Truman at a special news conference at Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada
Scopenote: Surrounded by photographers and reporters, President Harry S. Truman holds a special news conference on the lawn of the Seignory Club at Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada.  On his left is the Chief of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.  The others are unidentified.  The President is in Canada on a three-day trip during which he addressed a joint session of the Canadian Senate and Parliament.  (See also 65-581 thru 606.)  From:  Bjorn Bjornson

title: President Harry S. Truman at a special news conference at Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada
Scopenote: Surrounded by photographers and reporters, President Harry S. Truman holds a special news conference on the lawn of the Seignory Club at Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada.  On the right is U.S. Ambassador to Canada, Ray Atherton.  The President is on the last leg of his three-day trip to Canada during which he addressed a joint session of the Canadian Senate and Parliament.  (See also 65-581 thru 606.)  From:  Bjorn Bjornson.

title: Reporters gathered for a special news conference by President Harry S. Truman in Ontario, Canada
Scopenote: Photographers and reporters gather on the lawn of the Seignory Club at Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada, for a special news conference with President Harry S. Truman.  The President is on the last leg of a three-day trip to Canada during which he addressed a joint session of the Canadian Senate and Parliament.  (See also 65-581 thru 606.)  From:  Bjorn Bjornson

title: President Harry S. Truman arrives in Ontario, Canada, for a special news conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is presented with a bouquet of flowers by a little girl upon his arrival at the Seignory Club at Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada, where he will hold a special news conference.  The President is on the last leg of a three-day trip to Canada where he addressed a joint session of the Canadian Senate and Parliament.  Others in the photo are unidentified.  (See also 65-581 thru 606.)  From:  Bjorn Bjornson

title: The Seigniory Club at Montebello, Quebec, Canada
Scopenote: The Seigniory Club, Montebello, Quebec, Canada, where President Harry S. Truman (not shown) held a special news conference on the last leg of his three-day trip to Canada. (See also 65-581 thru 606.) From: Bjorn Bjornson

title: The Seignory Club at Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada, the site of President Harry S. Truman's press conference
Scopenote: The 18th hole at the Seignory Club (golf), Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada, where President Harry S. Truman, on the last leg of a three-day trip to Canada, held a special news conference.  (See also 65-581 thru 606.)  From:  Bjorn Bjornson

title: Former President Harry S. Truman stands alongside a Studebaker automobile at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman poses alongside a new, 1962 Studebaker Avanti automobile parked in the circle drive near the North entrance of the Harry S. Truman Library.  Next to the Avanti is a 1962 Studebaker Gran Turismo (GT) Hawk.  The automobiles were driven by the owner and employees of a Studebaker dealership who were visiting Mr. Truman at the Library.  From:  Fred D. Whitaker.

title: The Seignory Club at Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada, site of President Harry S. Truman's press conference
Scopenote: The Seignory Clubhouse (golf) near the 1st hole, Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada, where President Harry S. Truman held a special news conference on the last leg of his three-day trip to Canada.  (See 65-581 thru 606.)  From:  Bjorn Bjornson.

title: The Seignory Club at Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada, Site of President Harry S. Truman's Press Conference
Scopenote: The rock garden at the Seignory Club (golf), Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada, where President Harry S. Truman held a special news conference on the last leg of his three-day trip to Canada.  (See also 65-581 thru 606.)  From:  Bjorn Bjornson.

title: President Harry S. Truman at Niagara Falls, Canada
Scopenote: Surrounded by reporters and the Canadian Mounties, on his way back to the United States from a three-day trip to Canada, President Harry S. Truman stops to view Niagara Falls on the Canadian side.  From:  Bjorn Bjornson.

title: Canadian reporter Bjorn Bjornson at President Harry S. Truman's press conference in Canada
Scopenote: Just before President Harry S. Truman's press conference at the Seignory Club at Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada, Mrs. Bjorn Bjornson sneaked off and took a few honeymoon pictures of her husband, a Canadian reporter.  Reporters can be seen in the background waiting for the President.  From:  Bjorn Bjornson.

title: Canadian reporter Bjorn Bjornson at President Harry S. Truman's press conference in Canada
Scopenote: Just before President Harry S. Truman's press conference at the Seignory Club, Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada, Mrs. Bjorn Bjornson sneaked off and took a few honeymoon pictures of her husband, a Canadian reporter.  From:  Bjorn Bjornson.

title: Canadian reporter Bjorn Bjornson attending President Harry S. Truman's press conference in Canada
Scopenote: Just before President Harry S. Truman's press conference at the Seignory Club, Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada, Mrs. Bjorn Bjornson sneaked off and took a few honeymoon pictures of her husband, a Canadian reporter.  From:  Bjorn Bjornson.

title: Canadian reporter Bjorn Bjornson looks over a railing at Niagara Falls, Canada
Scopenote: Canadian reporter Bjorn Bjornson looks over a railing at Niagara Falls on the Canadian side.  He is with the press entourage covering President Harry S. Truman's three-day trip to Canada.  From:  Bjorn Bjornson.

title: Mrs. Bjorn Bjornson, wife of a Canadian reporter, at the Seignory Club, Ontario, Canada
Scopenote: Just before President Harry S. Truman's press conference at the Seignory Club, Monte-Bello, Ontario, Canada, Bjorn Bjornson, a Canadian reporter, sneaked off with his wife and took a picture of her sitting on a log.  From:  Bjorn Bjornson.

title: Mrs. Bjorn Bjornson, wife of a Canadian reporter, at the Seignory Club, Ontario, Canada

title: Mrs. Bjorn Bjornson, wife of a Canadian reporter, at the Seignory Club, Ontario, Canada

title: Former President Harry S. Truman, Major General Louis W. Truman and Others at Fort Lewis, Washington
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (fourth from left), hat in hand, Major General Louis W. Truman (right, front), Mr. Truman's second cousin, and a group of unidentified state dignitaries and staff officers of the 4th Infantry Division, salute the flag during the former President's visit to Fort Lewis, Washington.  Mr. Truman was in Seattle, Washington, to attend the Democratic party's annual Jefferson-Jackson Day Banquet.  From: Major General Louis W. Truman.

title: Autographed portrait of President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Official photograph of President Harry S. Truman at his desk in the White House (see 58-42) autographed as follows:  "Best wishes to Hon. Gerald T. Mullen, Harry S. Truman."  (Signed incorrectly; should be Mullin)

title: Mrs. Bjorn Bjornson, wife of a Canadian reporter, at Niagara Falls, Canada
Scopenote: Mrs. Bjorn Bjornson looks over a railing at Niagara Falls, on the Canadian side.  She is the wife of a Canadian reporter who is covering President Harry S. Truman's three-day trip to Canada.  From:  Bjorn Bjornson.

title: Photo of the Niagara River
Scopenote: Picture of the Niagara River taken through the window of a moving train on a cloudy day by Mrs. Bjorn Bjornson, wife of a Canadian reporter covering the three-day trip of President Harry S. Truman to Canada.  From:  Bjorn Bjornson.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Niagara Falls Mayor William L. Houck shake hands at the Falls
Scopenote: During his trip home from what he described as a "grand visit" to Canada, President Harry S. Truman viewed Niagara Falls.  With the Canadian falls roaring in the background, Mr. Truman is shown shaking hands with Mayor William L. Houck of Niagara Falls, Ontario.  "I'm glad I don't have to go over the falls in a barrel," the President remarked.  The presidential special pulled up on the Canadian side to let the President and his family motor around the falls.  Others in the photo are unidentified.  Donor:  Bjorn Bjornson.

title: Bjorn Bjornson, a Canadian reporter, and friend holding their fishing catch
Scopenote: Bjorn Bjornson (left), a Canadian reporter, and an unidentified friend stand on a dock holding fish, proudly displaying the size of their catch.  Mr. Bjornson was one of the reporters who covered President Truman's trip to Canada in 1947.  From:  Bjorn Bjornson.

title: Bjorn Bjornson, a Canadian reporter, and friend on an airplane stairway
Scopenote: Bjorn Bjornson (left), a Canadian reporter, and an unidentified photographer wave from the stairway of an airplane.  Mr. Bjornson covered the visit of President Truman to Canada in 1946.  From:  Bjorn Bjornson.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman, taken in New York City
Scopenote: Profile portrait of former President Harry S. Truman taken in front of a theater in New York City.  On the bottom of the photo is written:  "Taken by Gerald C. Bloch in front of theater in N.Y.  Inscribed copy June 4,'60."  From a box of miscellaneous photographs found in the audiovisual area.

title: Photo of a Lounge Chair Embossed with the Presidential Seal, a Gift to Former President Truman
Scopenote: Photo of a lounge chair bearing the seal of the President of the United States and upon which a gold name plate is affixed for Harry S. Truman, President of the United States.  It was shipped to the White House on July 20, 1949, as a personal gift from Arthur A. Lieberman.  From:  Arthur A. Lieberman, President, Carlton- Surrey Inc.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman holds a press conference at Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman held his first formal press conference in several years in Key West, Florida, at which he expressed his support for President Johnson.  Seated beneath a date palm tree at a Key West Hotel, he answered questions in rapid-fire order.  He is vacationing in Florida with his family.  (Original is in oversize drawer.) (See also 76-514.)  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman holds a press conference at Key West, Florida
Scopenote: Seated in a chair beneath a date palm tree at a hotel in Key West, Florida, former President Harry S. Truman holds his first formal press conference in several years.  Answering questions in rapid-fire order, he expressed his support for President Lyndon Johnson.  Mr. Truman is vacationing in Key West with his family.  (Original is in oversize drawer.)  From:  Found in box of miscellaneous photos in the audiovisual area.

title: Former President Truman, and others presenting plaque, in his Federal Reserve Bank office
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman receives a plaque from the Missouri Writer's Guild in his office at the Federal Reserve Bank Building.  The plaque is for his "Memoirs."  They are, left to right: Mrs. Grace Mitchell, Mr. Clifford H. Nowlin, Mr. Robert V. Harman, Mr. Cecil Perkins, and Mrs. Alta Armstrong. See also photo 58-449.  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: Autographed portrait of President Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Formal portrait of President Harry S. Truman (see 58-749) autographed as follows:  "Kind regards to Everett W. Jacobs, Harry Truman."

title: Former President Harry S. Truman at a Banquet at the Hotel Muehlebach, Kansas City
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center-back row) sits at the main dinner table enjoying a banquet at the Hotel Muehlebach in Kansas City, Missouri, in a room full of round tables and fellow dinner companions.  Mr. Truman's brother, Vivian Truman, is seated on the right at the main table.  The event and identity of the others are unknown.  (Photo is in the oversize drawer.)  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.
Institutional Creator: Farnan Foto Service, Kansas City, MO

title: Former President Harry S. Truman cuts a cake at a banquet at Hotel Muehlebach, Kansas City, Missouri
Scopenote: At a banquet at the Hotel Muehlebach in Kansas City, Missouri, a smiling former President Harry S. Truman is shown holding a knife preparatory to cutting a cake in hand.  The cake reads:  It's a Happy Day, Mr. President.  (See 2007-210 for a photo of the banquet.)  The event is unknown.    From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.
Institutional Creator: Farnan Foto Service, Kansas City, MO

title: Former President Harry S. Truman at a banquet at the Hotel Muehlebach in Kansas City, Missouri

Fourth on Truman's right is Col. L. Curtis Tiernan, Chaplain to the U.S. forces in Europe during World War II.  The others are unidentified.  (Original in oversize drawer.)  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman at a banquet at the Hotel Muehlebach in Kansas City, Missouri

Truman is sitting at the center of the head table, and fourth from his right is Col. L. Curtis Tiernan, Chaplain to the U.S. forces in Europe during World War II.  The others are unidentified, and the event and date are unknown.  (See also oversize photo 2007-212.)  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

Scopenote: Photo of the Washington Monument and Capitol building in Washington, D.C., as seen beyond a fountain and through a grove of trees in full leaf.  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman receives a plaque as First Commander-in-Chief of the U.S. Air Force
Scopenote: On the occasion of the 16th anniversary of the United States Air Force, former President Harry S. Truman accepts a plaque from an unidentified female member of the U.S. Air Force, which reads, in part: "In recognition of his understanding and appreciation of the Aero Space Age and for providing the United States of America with an independent Air Force to meet the challenges of the future, this testimonial is presented to Harry S. Truman, First Commander-in-Chief, United States Air Force...."  Others in the photo, left to right, are:  Orchestra leader Skitch Henderson, Toastmaster; Mr. Truman; Senator Stuart Symington; Hon. Eugene Zuckert, Secretary of the Air Force; and General Carl A. Spaatz.  The location is unknown. (Original in oversize drawer.)  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

Eugene Zuckert, Secretary of the Air Force; and General Carl A. Spaatz.  (Original photograph in oversize drawer.)  The location is unknown. title: Former President Truman is greeted at airport in Chicago by Mayor Daley and others

The former Chief Executive will be taking the all-Chicago Committee for the Harry S. Truman Library to Independence, Missouri, for an inspection tour of the building.  Left to right are:  Col. Jacob Arvey, Illinois Democratic National Committeeman; unidentified; former President Truman; Senator Adlai Stevenson; Mayor Richard Daley; and singer Phil Regan.  Donor:  Jacob Arvey.

title: Former President Truman Shakes Hands with Daley and Stevenson
Scopenote: After disembarking from a United Airlines plane, the "Truman Library Special," for a fund-raising mission, former President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with Chicago Mayor Richard Daley (at right) and former Illinois Governor Adlai Stevenson (third from left). The man on the extreme left is unidentified. The former Chief Executive will be taking the all-Chicago Committee for the Truman Library to Independence, Missouri, for an inspection tour of the building.  From:  Col. Jacob Arvey

title: Former President Harry S. Truman, Rex Whitton, Harris Rodgers, and Alonzo Gentry at Slover Park, Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman sits at a table in an enclosed picnic area at Slover Park, Independence, Missouri, the site of the proposed Truman Library.  With him are, left to right:  Rex M. Whitton, Chief Engineer, State Highway Commission; Mr. Truman; Harris Rodgers, Missouri Highway Commissioner; and Alonzo Gentry, architect for the Truman Library.  Their names and occupations are written on the photo in Mr. Truman's handwriting.  (Original in oversize drawer.)  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: Aerial view of the Truman Library during construction
Scopenote: Aerial view of the Truman Library and surroundings during construction showing the building well on the way to completion and construction of the access ramps from 24 Highway.  (Original in oversize drawer.)  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: Lithograph of Thomas Hart Benton mural in the lobby of the Harry S. Truman Library
Scopenote: Color reproduction of the Thomas Hart Benton mural "Independence and the Opening of the West" on the wall in the lobby of the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri.  An overlay in the center where the door is bears the words:  77th Birthday - President Harry S. Truman - May 8, 1961 - Mural Painting "Independence and the Opening of the West" by Thomas Hart Benton. This lithograph was passed out for the 77th birthday of President Truman.  See also 97-1937.  (Original in oversize drawer.)  Reproduction of works by Thomas Hart Benton must be approved by VAGA.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman at a Fleet Reserve Association Branch meeting in Kansas City, Kansas
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. (See 94-252 thru 255.) From: Naval Reserve

title: Three young Democrats adorn an automobile sporting Kennedy banners in front of Iolani Palace, Honolulu, Hawaii
Scopenote: Three young Democrats sit on the hood of an automobile "wrapped" with Kennedy for President banners and parked in front of Iolani Palace, Honolulu, Hawaii.  Left to right are:  Gwendolyn Mock, unidentified, and Kay Morris.  Several hundred youth banded together and formed a thriving "Youth for Kennedy" organization in Hawaii.  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: Portrait of Paul H. Griffith

title: Former President Harry S. Truman, Civil Air Patrol Cadets and Col. R.L. Clew at his Federal Reserve Bank office
Scopenote: Cadets of the Civil Air Patrol and Col. R.L. Clew, Rector, visit former President Harry S. Truman at his office in the Federal Reserve Bank Building, Kansas City, Missouri.  Col. R.L. Clew, Rector, is second from the left.  The other three are Roger Bigler, Al Ransom, and Stanley Baldwin, not necessarily in that order on the photo. title: Former President Harry S. Truman and Detectives Cleary and Katukes in Milwaukee, Wisconsin
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman stands between Detective Walter W. Cleary and Detective George J. Katukes during his visit to Milwaukee, Wisconsin, where he spoke at the annual Jefferson-Jackson Day dinner at the Milwaukee Auditorium.  The photo is autographed:  "Good Luck - Best Wishes - Detective Walter W. Cleary, 6-21-57" and "Best Wishes, Det. George J. Katukes."  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: Donkey wearing "Vote Democratic" blanket
Scopenote: Photographed in a residential backyard, a donkey hits the campaign trail wearing a "Vote Democratic" poster and a straw hat.  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: President Harry S. Truman surrounded by a crowd at a train station
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greets a crowd of supporters gathered outside a rail car at a train station. It appears to be Mayor Roger Sermon of Independence, Missouri at far left, so President Truman may be arriving in Independence.  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous unidentified photographs found in the audiovisual area.

title: Labor leaders Carey, McDonald, and Reuther present checks to Basil O'Connor for Truman Library fund raising
Scopenote: At ceremonies at CIO headquarters, CIO President Walter Reuther, CIO Secretary-Treasurer James B. Carey and USA-CIO President David J. McDonald presented checks in the amount of $250,000 to Basil O'Connor, chairman of the Executive Committee of the Harry S. Truman Library, Inc., to be used for construction of the Truman Library at Grandview, Missouri.  The CIO contribution amounted to $150,000, and the gift of the Steelworkers Union was for $100,000.  Left to right are:  James B. Carey, Basil O'Connor, David J. McDonald, and Walter Reuther.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Brigadier General R. Dinwiddie Groves at the New Organized Reserve Corps Armory, Kansas City
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) walks with Brigadier General R. Dinwiddie Groves on their way to the Organized Reserve Corps Armory at 1600 Central, Kansas City, Missouri, where the President is scheduled to dedicate the new building.  (See also 77-1715 and 1716.)  From:  Reserve Officers Association.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Brigadier General R. Dinwiddie Groves and Others at the New Organized Reserve Corps Armory, Kansas City
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, dark suit), surrounded by unidentified officers and civilians, holds onto the arm of Brigadier General R. Dinwiddie Groves, who is escorting him to the dedication of the new Organized Reserve Corps Armory at 1600 Central, Kansas City, Missouri.  (See also 77-1715 and 1716.)  From:  Reserve Officers Association.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Brigadier General R. Dinwiddie Groves and Others at the New Organized Reserve Corps Armory, Kansas City
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, dark suit), surrounded by unidentified Army officers and civilians, holds onto the arm of Brigadier General R. Dinwiddie Groves, who is escorting him to the dedication of the new Organized Reserve Corps Armory at 1600 Central, Kansas City, Missouri.  (See also 77-1715 and 1716.)  From:  Reserve Officers Association, U.S. Army.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Brigadier General R. Dinwiddie Groves and others at the New Organized Reserve Corps Armory, Kansas City
Scopenote: Surrounded by photographers, President Harry S. Truman (front, dark suit), with Brigadier General R. Dinwiddie Groves at right, poses for a photo with a group of unidentified officers standing at attention and saluting. The President is to dedicate the new Organized Reserve Corps Armory at 1600 Central, Kansas City, Missouri.  (See also 77-1715 and 1716.)  From:  Reserve Officers Association, U.S. Army.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Brigadier General R. Dinwiddie Groves and Others at the New Organized Reserve Corps Armory, Kansas City
Scopenote: A group of Army officers offers a salute to President Harry S. Truman as they pose for photo opportunity (President Truman is center, dark suit).  The officers are unidentified except for Brigadier General R. Dinwiddie Groves on the right.  The President is to dedicate the new Organized Reserve Corps Armory at 1600 Central, Kansas City, Missouri.  (See also 77-1715 and 1716.)  From:  Reserve Officers Association, U.S. Army.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Brigadier General R. Dinwiddie Groves and others at the new Organized Reserve Corps Armory, Kansas City
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, dark suit), with Brigadier General R. Dinwiddie Groves (right) stands in front of a group of unidentified officers at the Organized Reserve Corps Armory, 1600 Central, Kansas City, Missouri, where he is to dedicate the new building.  (See also 77-1715 and 1716.)  From:  Reserve Officers Association, U.S. Army

title: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with Army personnel at the dedication of an Organized Reserve Corps Armory
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, followed by Brig. General R. Dinwiddie Groves and an unidentified officer,  moves down a long line of Army personnel and shakes hands with each individual.  All are there to attend the dedication of the new Organized Reserve Corps Armory at 1600 Central, Kansas City, Missouri.  (See also 77-1715 and 1716.)  From:  Reserve Officers Association

title: President Harry S. Truman, Brig. Gen. R. Dinwiddie Groves and others at the new Organized Reserve Corps Armory, Kansas City
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (dark suit), next to Brig. General R. Dinwiddie Groves, poses for a photo opportunity among a group of unidentified Army officers standing at attention and saluting, at the Organized Reserve Corps Armory, 1600 Central, Kansas City, Missouri, where he will dedicate the new building.  (See also 77-1715 and 1716.)  From:  Reserve Officers Association, U.S. Army.

title: Former President Truman at an AFL-CIO Banquet in New York City
Scopenote: In New York City at an AFL-CIO banquet, former President Harry S. Truman sits at the dinner table listening to the conversation of two unidentified labor leaders.    From:  AFL-CIO Community Service Activities, 9 East 40th St., New York 16, N.Y.

title: Former President Truman Acknowledging Introduction at an AFL-CIO banquet in New York City
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) sits at the dinner table at a banquet given by the AFL-CIO in New York City and acknowledges the applause engendered by his introduction.  The two men on his right are unknown.  From:  AFL-CIO Community Service Activities, 9 East 40th St., New York 16, N.Y.

title: In Cleveland, Ohio, former President Harry S. Truman speaks at a fund raising dinner for the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman speaks at a fund-raising dinner in Cleveland, Ohio for the Harry S. Truman Library.  Directly behind him is Cyrus Eaton, industrial magnate.  In the right-hand corner is Basil O'Connor of Harry S. Truman Library, Inc.  The others are unknown.

title: Former President Truman Shakes Hands with a Labor Leader at AFL-CIO Banquet in New York City
Scopenote: After an introduction as guest of honor at an AFL-CIO banquet in New York City, former President Harry S. Truman (right) shakes hands with an unidentified labor leader.  From:  AFL-CIO Community Service Activities, 9 East 40th St., New York 16, N.Y.

title: Former President Truman Receives a Check at AFL-CIO Banquet in New York City
Scopenote: A beaming former President Harry S. Truman (right) and an unidentified labor leader hold a $5,000 check which was presented to the former President at an AFL-CIO banquet in New York City.    From:  AFL-CIO Community Service Activities, 9 East 40th St., New York 16, N.Y.

title: Former President Truman receives a Check and Medallion at AFL-CIO Banquet in New York City
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) is presented with a $5,000 check and a commemorative medal by an unidentified labor leader at an AFL-CIO banquet in New York City.    From:  AFL-CIO Community Service Activities, 9 East 40th St., New York, 16, N.Y.

title: Former President Truman Receives Check and Medallion at AFL-CIO Banquet in New York City
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) is presented with a $5,000 check and a commemorative medal by an unidentified labor leader at an AFL-CIO banquet in New York City. From: AFL-CIO Community Service Activities, 9 East 40th St., New York 16, N.Y.

title: Former President Truman receives a Check and Medallion at an AFL-CIO Banquet in New York City
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) peruses a $5,000 check and medallion presented by an unidentified labor leader at an AFL-CIO banquet in New York City.    From:  AFL-CIO Community Service Activities, 9 East 40th St., New York 16, N.Y.

title: Former President Truman Receives Check at AFL-CIO Banquet in New York City
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman receives the applause of an unidentified labor leader as he accepts a $5,000 check at an AFL-CIO banquet in New York City.    From:  AFL-CIO Community Service Activities, 9 East 40th St., New York 16, N.Y.

title: Former President Truman Receives Check at an AFL-CIO Banquet in New York City
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) holds a $5,000 check presented to him by an unidentified labor leader (left) at an AFL-CIO banquet in New York City.    From:  AFL-CIO Community Service Activities, 9 East 40th St., New York 16, N.Y.

title: Former President Truman Receives Check at AFL-CIO Banquet in New York City
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) and an unidentified labor leader pose for a photo, each holding a corner of a $5,000 check presented to Mr. Truman by the AFL-CIO at a banquet held in New York City. From: AFL-CIO Community Service Activities, 9 East 40th St., New York 165, N.Y.

title: Former President Truman Accepts Check at AFL-CIO Banquet in New York City
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) expresses his thanks to an unidentified labor leader after being presented with a $5,000 check and medallion from the AFL-CIO at a banquet held in New York City.    From:  AFL-CIO Community Service Activities, 9 East 40th St., New York 16, N.Y.

title: Former President Truman at the Head Table at an AFL-CIO Banquet in New York City
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (center) sits at the head dinner table at an AFL-CIO banquet in New York City, where he is to give an address.  On his right is an unidentified labor leader with another at the podium.    From:  AFL-CIO Community Service Activities, 9 East 40th St., New York 16, N.Y.
