Scopenote: In Cleveland, Ohio, Basil O'Connor of the Harry S. Truman Library, Inc., speaks at a fund raising dinner for the Harry S. Truman Library.  Seated on the right is former President Harry S. Truman.  The others are unidentified.  From:  Harry S. Truman Library, Inc.

title: Former President Truman at the Podium at AFL-CIO Banquet in New York City
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman takes the podium at an AFL-CIO banquet in New York City and expresses his thanks for the gift of a $5,000 check and medallion.  From:  AFL-CIO Community Service Activities, 9 East 40th St., New York 16, N.Y.

title: Former President Truman speaking at an AFL-CIO Banquet in New York City
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman is shown at the podium speaking to union members at an AFL-CIO banquet in New York City. From: AFL-CIO Community Service Activities, 9 East 40th St., New York 16, N.Y.

title: Former President Truman speaks at AFL-CIO Banquet in New York City
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman is shown at the podium speaking to union members at an AFL-CIO banquet in New York City.    From:  AFL-CIO Community Service Activities, 9 East 40th St., New York 16, N.Y.

title: Former President Truman With a Labor Representative at an AFL-CIO Banquet
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right)converses with an unidentified labor representative at an AFL-CIO banquet in New York City.  (See also 2007-268 through 282.)  From:  AFL-CIO Community Service Activities, 9 East 40th St., New York 16, N.Y.

title: Harry S. Truman with Brig. General R. Dinwiddie Groves and Air Force personnel
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands at the base of an airplane off-ramp with Brig. General R. Dinwiddie Groves (left) and three unidentified Air Force personnel.    From:  Reserve Officers Association, U.S. Army.

title: President Truman with Brig. General Dinwiddie Groves and Others
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman stands at the base of an airplane off-ramp with Brig. General R. Dinwiddie Groves (left), a group of civilians, and three Air Force personnel.  The event, location, and date are unknown.  From:  Reserve Officers Association, U.S. Army

title: Former President Harry S. Truman, Bess, and Margaret Truman at the dedication of the Maryville, Missouri Post Office
Scopenote: Holding a bouquet of roses, Bess Truman sits next to her husband, former President Harry S. Truman, with Margaret Truman standing behind, inside the new Post Office in Maryville, Missouri.  Mr. Truman spoke at the dedication of the new building before a crowd estimated at 2,500.  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman and Mrs. Truman's nephew, David Truman, at a Colorado airport
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with David Truman, Bess Truman's nephew, as Mr. Truman prepares to board a Continental airplane at the Denver airport on his way back to Kansas City.  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: Portrait of an unidentified man calling himself "The Admiral"
Scopenote: Portrait of an unidentified man standing in front of a flag.  The photo matte is autographed as follows:  "To one of the best knock, them for a loop.  From the Admiral"  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: Former President Truman with Five 35th Division Army Personnel
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman poses for a group picture with five unidentified 35th Division Army personnel. The soldiers have signed their names (not all legible) at the bottom by their feet.  The meeting appears to be on a base.  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs from the audiovisual area.

title: View of the laying of the foundation of the Truman Library
Scopenote: View of the construction site of the proposed Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, particularly the laying of the foundation.  From:  J.R. Fuchs.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman sitting before a gallery of former Presidents' portraits
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman sits in front of a gallery of portraits of former United States Presidents.  (Photo in oversize drawer.)  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: President Harry S. Truman and Mrs. Woodrow Wilson sit on a Bench on the White House Lawn
Scopenote: Edith Wilson, wife of World War I President, Woodrow Wilson, sits on a bench and converses with President Harry S. Truman during a White House lawn party for sick and disabled members of the Armed Forces.  Mrs. Wilson originated the annual affair after World War I.  (See also 92-364.) (Photo in oversize drawer)  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman (from back), and unidentified men standing by a plane
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman watches as an unidentified man shakes hands with an unidentified Air Force officer standing underneath the engine of a propeller airplane. From: Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: Former President Truman shakes hands with an unidentified Air Force officer at Airplane
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman disembarks from a plane and shakes hands with an unidentified Air Force officer waiting to greet him.    From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: Former President Truman with Others at an Unidentified Airport
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) poses for a photo with two unidentified men and two unidentified Air Force officers underneath the wings of an airplane.    From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman and an unidentified Air Force officer stand at attention
Scopenote: After disembarking from an airplane, former President Harry S. Truman (left) and an unidentified Air Force officer stand at attention.    From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Greeted by Unidentified Man
Scopenote: After disembarking from a plane, former President Harry S. Truman chats with an unidentified dignitary under the wing of the airplane.    From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: President Harry S. Truman inspects a group of Air Force military police
Scopenote: After disembarking from the plane seen in the background, President Harry S. Truman and an unidentified officer inspect a group of Air Force Military Police.    From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the audiovisual area.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman in his office at the Federal Reserve Bank Building, Kansas City, Missouri, full length
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman stands on an oriental rug before his desk in his office at the Federal Reserve Bank Building, Kansas City, Missouri.  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the Audio/Visual area.
Institutional Creator: Collins Photo Co., Kansas City, MO

title: Former President Harry S. Truman and his guard, Mike Westwood, at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman enters the Harry S. Truman Library ready for a day's work.  Under his arm is a portfolio of Remington's paintings entitled "Buckskins."  Mike (Paul) Westwood, an Independence Police Officer and Mr. Truman's guard, assists the former President with his suitcase.    From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the Audio/Visual area.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman, Major Gen. Louis W. Truman and an unidentified officer salute the flag
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right), Major General Louis W. Truman (left), Truman's 2nd cousin, and an unidentified officer salute the flag as they pass the Color Guard during a review of members of the 4th Infantry Division at Fort Lewis, Washington. Mr. Truman was in Seattle, Washington, to attend the Democratic party's annual Jefferson-Jackson Day Banquet. From: Major General Louis W. Truman.

title: View of the laying of the foundation of the Truman Library
Scopenote: View of the construction site of the proposed Harry S. Truman Library, particularly, the laying of the foundation.  From:  J.R. Fuchs.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman and a reporter in Mr. Truman's office at the Federal Reserve Bank Building
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, behind his desk at his office in the Federal Reserve Bank Building, Kansas City, Missouri, is interviewed by an unidentified reporter from the Inter-City Press.  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the Audio/Visual area.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman shows three unidentified visitors around the Truman Library
Scopenote: Standing in front of a wall of political cartoons, former President Harry S. Truman explains an exhibit to three unidentified dignitaries touring the Truman Library in Independence, Missouri.   From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the Audio/Visual area.

title: Former President Truman with Visitor in his Office at Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman sits behind his desk at his office at the Harry S. Truman Library, and chats with an unidentified man at left.  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the Audio/Visual area.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman at a conference in the Research Room of the Truman Library
Scopenote: Faded snapshot of former President Harry S. Truman (center, first row) at a conference held in the Research Room of the Truman Library, Independence, Missouri.  Of those who can be identified are Forrest C. Pogue (right, first row) and Charles Murphy (standing, 5th from right).   From:  Stan Wrabee, Conception Seminary, Conception, Missouri.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman at a conference in the Research Room of the Truman Library
Scopenote: Faded snapshot of former President Harry S. Truman (center, first row) at a conference held in the Research Room of the Truman Library, Independence, Missouri.  Of those who can be identified are Forrest C. Pogue (right, first row) and Charles Murphy (standing, 5th from right).    From San Wrabee, Conception Seminary

title: Former President Harry S. Truman at a conference in the Research Room of the Truman Library
Scopenote: Faded snapshot of former President Harry S. Truman (center, first row) at a conference held in the Research Room of the Truman Library, Independence, Missouri.  Of those who can be identified are Forrest C. Pogue (right, first row) and Charles Murphy (standing, 5th from right).   From:  Sam Wrabee, Conception Seminary.

title: Former President Truman and Others in Research Room of Truman Library
Scopenote: Faded snapshot of former President Harry S. Truman, flanked by two unidentified men, sitting underneath his Masonic portrait during a conference held in the Research Room of the Harry S. Truman Library, Independence, Missouri.    From: Sam Wrabee, Conception Seminary.

title: Former President Truman and Others in the Research Room of the Truman Library
Scopenote: Faded snapshot of former President Harry S. Truman, flanked by two unidentified men, sitting underneath his formal Masonic portrait during a conference held in the Research Room of the Truman Library, Independence, Missouri.    From:  Sam Wrabee, Conception Seminary.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman stands beside his Masonic portrait in the Truman Library
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman poses in front of his Masonic portrait painted by Greta Kempton which is displayed in the Research Room of the Truman Library, Independence, Missouri.  From:  Sam Wrabee, Conception Seminary.

title: Faded Snapshot of Greta Kempton painting of President Harry S. Truman in Masonic Regalia
Scopenote: Faded snapshot of the Greta Kempton painting of former President Harry S. Truman in Masonic regalia hanging in the Research Room of the Truman Library, Independence, Missouri.  From:  Sam Wrabee, Conception Seminary

title: View of the laying of the foundation of the Truman Library
Scopenote: View of the construction site of the proposed Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, particularly, the laying of the foundation.  From:  J.R. Fuchs.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman and an unidentified man in front of the Naval Reserve Training center
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman, cane and briefcase in hand, poses with an unidentified man in front of the Naval Reserve Training Center.  The location and date are unknown.  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the Audio/Visual area.

title: Former President Truman and Unidentified Man at Airport
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) and an unidentified man stand under the wing of a propeller plane.    From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the Audio/Visual area.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman and Unidentified Men at Party
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman, drink in hand, chats with three unidentified men at party.    From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photos in the Audio/Visual area.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman, Charles Ross and unidentified others
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (left), drink in hand, and Charles Ross (second from left), converse with two unidentified men.  The event, date, and location are unknown.  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the Audio/Visual area.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman and Unidentified Men
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman, drink in hand, converses with three unidentified men.    From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the Audio/Visual area.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman and an unidentified man
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman converses with an unidentified man.  The location, date, and event are unknown.  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the Audio/Visual area

title: Harry S. Truman, Wearing an Overcoat, with  Unidentified Men
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman, wearing an overcoat, stops to share a cup of coffee and a donut with two unidentified men.  In the background is a map of the United States.    From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the Audio/Visual area

title: Former President Harry S. Truman, Bess Truman, and Unidentified Others at a Chicago Train Station
Scopenote: After alighting from a train at Dearborn Station in Chicago, Former President Harry S. Truman and his wife Bess are escorted from the station by an unidentified man and the Station Master. (See also 70-140.) From: Found in a box of miscellaneous photographs in the Audio/Visual area.

title: Portrait of Helen Wallace as an infant
Scopenote: Studio portrait of Helen Wallace as an infant.  Helen Wallace, Bess Truman's cousin from Kansas City, is the child of Myra Gates Wallace, Madge Gates' sister, who married Theodore Boulware Wallace.  From:  John Elliott

title: Helen Wallace as a child
Scopenote: Informal portrait of Helen Wallace, probably two or three years of age, with her hands raised and holding on to her hair.  Helen Wallace, Bess Truman's cousin from Kansas City, is the child of Myra Gates Wallace, Madge Gates' sister, who married Theodore Boulware Wallace.  From:  John Elliott.

title: View of the Laying of the Foundation of the Truman Library
Scopenote: View of the construction site of the proposed Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri,  particularly, the laying of the foundation  From:  J.R. Fuchs.

title: George Wallace, Helen Wallace, and Maud Louise Wells as children
Scopenote: Left to right:  George Wallace, Helen Wallace, and Maud Louise Wells sit on the steps of the front porch of the George Porterfield Gates home at 219 N. Delaware, Independence Missouri.  George Wallace is Bess Wallace's brother.  Helen Wallace is the child of Myra Gates Wallace, Madge Gates' sister, and Maud Louise Wells is the daughter of Maud Gates Wells, Madge Gates' other sister.  From:  John Elliott.

title: Early photograph of the Truman home with George Porterfield Gates in front
Scopenote: Beautiful 1893 photo of the George Porterfield Gates residence at 219 N. Delaware, Independence, Missouri (also known as the Truman home).  Standing in front of the house is, apparently, George Porterfield Gates.  Note the carriage block at the street.  From:  John Elliott (Duplicate by written permission of owner only.)

title: Portrait of Theodore Boulware Wallace in profile
Scopenote: Profile portrait of Theodore Boulware Wallace, husband of Myra Gates Wallace (sister of Madge Gates Wallace).    From:  John Elliott

title: Portrait of Theodore Boulware Wallace
Scopenote: Head-and-shoulders portrait of Theodore Boulware Wallace, husband of Myra Gates Wallace (sister of Madge Gates Wallace).  From:  John Elliott.

title: Portrait of Jessamine Young Wallace, mother of Theodore Boulware Wallace
Scopenote: Head-and-should portrait of Jessamine Young Wallace, mother of Theodore Boulware Wallace (who married Myra Gates, sister of Madge Gates).  From:  John Elliott.

title: Portrait of Jessamine Wallace
Scopenote: Head-and-shoulders portrait of Grandmother Jessamine Wallace, formerly Jessamine Young, mother of Theodore Boulware Wallace (who married Myra Gates, sister of Madge Gates Wallace).  From:  John Elliott

title: Portrait of Jessamine Wallace, mother of Theodore Boulware Wallace
Scopenote: Portrait of Jessamine Wallace, formerly Jessamine Young, mother of Theodore Boulware Wallace (who married Myra Gates, sister of Madge Gates Wallace).  From:  John Elliott

title: Portrait of Madge Gates Wallace as a young woman
Scopenote: Head-and-shoulders portrait of a young Madge Gates Wallace, mother of Bess Wallace Truman  From:  John Elliott.

title: Portrait of Madge Gates Wallace
Scopenote: Head-and-shoulders portrait of a young Madge Gates Wallace, mother of Bess Wallace Truman.  From:  John Elliott

title: Young Bess Wallace and relatives on the front porch of a large stone house
Scopenote: A group of Wallace, Gates, and Wells children sit on the porch of a large stone house identified only as 115 Waldron Ave., Kansas City, Missouri.  Left to right (standing) are:  Maud Louise Gates, George Wallace, and Bess Wallace.  Left to right (sitting) are Louise Wells, Helen Wallace, John Wallace, Oscar Wells, and Fred Wallace.  (See also 82-163-2.)  From:  John Elliott.

title: View of the laying of the foundation of the Truman Library
Scopenote: View of the construction site of the proposed Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, particularly the laying of the foundation.  From:  J.R. Fuchs.

title: Aunt Lizzie, "Uncle Will," and Will Wallace
Scopenote: Will Wallace, a young child, sits on a mule, watched over by "Aunt Lizzie" and "Uncle Will,"  presumed to be members of the Theodore Boulware Wallace family.  T.B. Wallace married Myra Gates, sister of Madge Gates (mother of Bess Truman).  From:  John Elliott.

title: Portrait of Frank E. Gates
Scopenote: Full-length portrait of Frank E. Gates, of the George Porterfield Gates family, standing under a tree on what appears to be a country lane.    From John Elliott

title: Portrait of Maud Louise Gates Wells (Drake) as a child
Scopenote: Head portrait of Maud Louise Gates Wells (Drake) as a child.  She is the daughter of G. Walter Gates, and first cousin of Bess Wallace Truman.    From:  John Elliott.

title: Portrait of Maud Louise Gates Drake
Scopenote: Head-and-shoulders portrait (in a 7.5 inch diameter circle) of Maud Louise Gates Wells (Drake) wearing a large hat.  She is the daughter of G. Walter Gates and first cousin of Bess Wallace Truman. From:  John Elliott.

title: Portrait of Maud Gates Wells as a young woman
Scopenote: Head-and-shoulders portrait of Maud Gates Wells, sister of Bess Truman's mother and wife of Strother Wells, as a young woman.  From:  John Elliott.

title: Portrait of John Emery Wallace at 9 months
Scopenote: Studio portrait of John Emery Wallace at 9 months of age.  John is Bess Truman's cousin from Kansas City, child of Myra Wallace, Madge Gates Wallace's sister who married Theodore Boulware Wallace.  From:  John Elliott.

title: Portrait of Susan Bedford
Scopenote: Full-length studio portrait of Susan Bedford.  The photo was in an album of Wallace family relatives.  From:  John Elliott

title: A young Bess Wallace with relatives in front of 219 N. Delaware, Independence, Missouri
Scopenote: Standing in front of the Gates/Wallace house at 219 N. Delaware, Independence, Missouri, are, left to right:  (First row) Helen Wallace, Gates Wells, and Louise Wells; (Second row) Frank Wallace, George Wallace, and Bess Wallace (Bess and her brothers).  The other children are their cousins.  Bess and Frank are probably in their teens; the others are much younger.   From:  John Elliott (restricted at request of donor)

title: Portrait of Judge William H. Wallace
Scopenote: Head-and-shoulders, profile portrait of Judge William H. Wallace.  Photo was in an album of the Gates/Wallace family.  From:  John Elliott

title: Three Portraits of a Woman Identified Only as "Susie"
Scopenote: Two profile and one front head-and-shoulders portrait of a woman identified only as "Susie" on one photo.  The donor suggests that she may have been Myra Sue, sister of Maud and Madge Gates.  The photo was in an album of the Gates/Wallace family.  From:  John Elliott (Duplicate by written permission of owner.)

title: View of the laying of the foundation of the Truman Library
Scopenote: View of the construction site of the proposed Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, particularly the laying of the foundation.  From:  J.R. Fuchs.

title: Two unidentified boys from a Gates/Wallace family album
Scopenote: Two unidentified young boys in overalls pose in front of a rock formation, possibly in the Garden of the Gods, Colorado, during a Wallace family vacation.  The photo was in a Gates/Wallace family album.  From:  John Elliott

title: Portrait of an unidentified Midshipman from Gates/Wallace family
Scopenote: An unidentified Midshipman, wearing his military uniform, poses outdoors for a full length portrait.  The photo was in a Gates/Wallace family album.  From:  John Elliott

title: Portrait of an Older Maud Louise Gates Wells
Scopenote: Upper-body portrait of an older Maud Louise Gates Wells (see also photo 2009-1615).  The photo was in a Gates/Wallace family album.  From:  John Elliott.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Inspects an Exhibit of China used on the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: At the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, former President Harry S. Truman (third from the left) and an unidentified man and woman inspect an exhibit of the china service used aboard the presidential yacht, U.S.S. Williamsburg.  Selections include dinnerware, crystal and flatware.  The man on the right is also unidentified.  (See also 77-4085.)  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photos in the Audio/Visual area.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman poses with a "baby shower" cake
Scopenote: A beaming former President Harry S. Truman stands next to a table holding a cake which reads "Happy Day, Mr. President."  The cake is decorated with a stork and baby buggy, and there is a luncheon table in the background, indicating that it is probably a baby shower for his first grandchild.   From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photos in the Audiovisual area.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman at a luncheon with three unidentified men
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman stands behind the luncheon table and chats with three unidentified men who have eyes only for the camera.  The location, event, and date are unknown.  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photos in the Audiovisual area

title: Former President Harry S. Truman grins for the camera during a luncheon engagement
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman sits in a chair and grins for the camera during a luncheon.  The man on the right is unidentified, and the location, event, and date are also unknown.  (See also 2007-346.)  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photos in the Audiovisual area.

title: House in Cheppy, France during World War I
Scopenote: House in Cheppy, France, just east of the town of Varennes, where Captain Harry S. Truman charged the enemy with a "Goniometer" during the first World War.  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photos in the Audio/Visual area.

title: President Harry S. Truman at a train station, surrounded by a group of admirers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman talks with people waiting to greet him at a train station.  On his left is the train, and on his right is a convertible waiting to take him to his destination.  The location and date are unknown.  From:  Found in a box of miscellaneous photos in the Audiovisual area.

title: View of the laying of the foundation of the Truman Library
Scopenote: View of the construction site of the proposed Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, Missouri, particularly the laying of the foundation.  From:  J.R. Fuchs.

title: President Harry S. Truman at a train station surrounded by a group of admirers
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman is greeted by a group of loyal supporters after disembarking from a train, seen in the background. Location and date unknown. From: Found in a box of miscellaneous photos in the Audiovisual area.

title: Harry S. Truman during 1952 campaign
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman standing at rear platform of a train pointing, with his cane, to a sign to vote for Stevenson and Sparkman.  From:  Copied from original photographs loaned to library by Harry Barth.  Originals were returned to Mr. Barth.

title: The Truman family voting in general election

They cast their vote in the seventh precinct of Blue Township in the Memorial Building in Independence, Missouri.    From:  Copied from original photographs loaned to the library by Harry Barth.  Originals were returned to Mr. Barth.

title: The Truman Family voting in the general election
Scopenote: George A. Wallace, a Democratic Judge at the polling place and the brother-in-law of President Harry S. Truman, shakes hands with President Truman.  Also shown are Bess Truman (to the left of President Truman) and Margaret Truman.  They are voting in the general election at the seventh precinct of Blue Township located in the Memorial Building in Independence, Missouri.  From:  Copied from original photographs loaned to the library by Harry Barth.  Originals were returned to Mr. Barth.

title: Harry S. Truman announced publication of two new books
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman announced his two new books at a press conference in his office at the Federal Reserve Bank.  "Years of Decision", Volume 1 of his memoirs will be published on November 2.  The second volume, "Years of Trial and Hope" will be published in early 1956.  From:  Copied from original photographs loaned to the library by Harry Barth.  Originals were returned to Mr. Barth.

In the back seat, left to right, Mrs. Frank (Natalie) Wallace, Bess Truman, and Mrs. George (May) Wallace.  Margaret came home to prepare for her wedding.  (See also 67-4666)  From:  Copied from original photographs loaned to the library by Harry Barth.  Originals were returned to Mr. Barth.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman, Maj. Gen. Louis W. Truman, Mr. and Mrs. Clyde Kimbrough at Fort Lewis, Washington

Truman reaches for the hand of Clyde Kimbrough, standing in a receiving line, who is holding a display of campaign buttons to be presented to Mr. Truman at ceremonies during his visit to Fort Lewis, Washington.  Behind the former President is Major General Louis W. Truman, Truman's second cousin, and standing next to Mr. Kimbrough is his wife.  Mr. Kimbrough is the principal civilian Post Engineer at the Fort.  From:  Major General Louis W. Truman.
