title: Marines of the 5th Regiment during Korean War
Scopenote: Marines of the 5th Regiment waiting to board ship near Pusan, Korea during the Korean War.

title: Marines of the 5th Regiment march during Korean War
Scopenote: Marines of the 5th Regiment, waiting to board ship, march in an orderly manner to the 'gang plank' near Pusan, Korea, during the Korean War.

title: A lone horse and rider on the Truman farm in Grandview, Missouri
Scopenote: An unidentified horseman and steed cantor across a field in front of outbuildings on the Truman farm in Grandview, Missouri (Original negative included).  From:  Fred Truman.

title: South Korean Marines during Korean War
Scopenote: South Korean Marines waiting to go aboard the U.S.S. Pickaway near Pusan, Korea, during Korean War.

title: South Korean Marines during Korean War
Scopenote: South Korean Marines waiting to go aboard the U. S. S. Pickaway get sprayed with D.D.T. near Pusan, Korea during the Korean War.

title: White British Hospital Ship in Pusan Harbor
Scopenote: White British Hospital Ship in Pusan Harbor near Pusan, Korea during Korean War.

title: British Hospital Ship during Korean War
Scopenote: Close up of British Hospital Ship near Pusan, Korea. (Double Exposure)

title: British Hospital Ship during Korean War
Scopenote: British Hospital Ship near Pusan, Korea.

title: Looking over the fantail of the U. S. S. Pickaway during Korean War
Scopenote: Looking south over the fantail of the U. S. S. Pickaway, at sea during the Korean War.

title: Two ships of convoy carrying United States Marines to Inchon, Korea
Scopenote: Two ships of convoy carrying United States Marines to Inchon, Korea, aboard the U. S. S. Pickaway at sea.

title: The "Gunston Hall," a ship during the Korean War
Scopenote: The "Gunston Hall" pulling along side of the U.S.S. Pickaway to transfer a wounded Marine. Private Richard D. Kenney accidentally shot himself while cleaning his .45 caliber pistol.

title: The "Gunston Hall" during the Korean War
Scopenote: Crew members of the ship Gunston Hall prepare to send the litter across to transfer a wounded marine.  Private Richard D. Kenney accidentally shot himself while cleaning his .45 caliber pistol aboard the U. S. S. Pickaway.

title: The ship "Gunston Hall" during Korean War
Scopenote: The cables between the Gunston Hall and the U.S.S. Pickaway are secured and the litter started across to transfer a wounded Marine.  Private Richard D. Kenney accidentally shot himself while cleaning his .45 caliber pistol. This was during the Korean War.

title: A lone horse and rider on the Truman farm in Grandview, Missouri
Scopenote: An unidentified horseman and steed walk across a field in front of outbuildings on the Truman farm in Grandview, Missouri. (Original negative included)  From:  Fred Truman.

title: The Gunston Hall, a ship during the Korean War
Scopenote: The litter half way across to transfer a wounded marine from the U.S.S. Pickaway to the Gunston Hall.  Private Richard D. Kenney accidentally shot himself while cleaning his .45 caliber pistol.

title: Colonel Shin Hyun Jun, General Frank E. Lowe, Admiral Sohn Won Yil, and Captain A. G. Hume
Scopenote: Colonel Shin Hyun Jun, Korean Marines Regimental Commander; General Frank E. Lowe; Admiral Sohn Won Yil, Chief of Korean Naval Operations; and Captain A. G. Hume.  Taken in the ship's mess hall aboard the U.S.S. Pickaway at sea.

title: Photo from the U. S. S. Pickaway en route to Inchon
Scopenote: In the center background we see the first ship of the convoy that left from Japan.  Their convoy joined the United States for the Inchon assault.  These are the observations of General Frank E. Lowe (not pictured) aboard the U. S. S. Pickaway at sea.

title: Sailing towards Inchon on U. S. S. Pickaway
Scopenote: Sailing toward Inchon aboard the U.S.S. Pickaway during the Korean War.  Photo taken from the Captain's bridge.

title: USS Pickaway in the Korean War
Scopenote: A view of the forward portion of the USS Pickaway taken from the Captain's bridge, during the Korean War.  This ship carried General Frank E. Lowe (not pictured) to the Inchon assault.

title: A.P.A. 104 during Korean War
Scopenote: A.P.A. 104 gets a little close to the U. S. S. Pickaway on a turn.  The A.P.A. 104 carried elements of the 5th Marine Regiment during the Korean War.

title: View from the U. S. S. Pickaway en route to Inchon
Scopenote: A.P.A.'s, A.K.A.'s and L.S.T.'s join our convoy at a prearranged point prior to sailing into Inchon Harbor. This photo was taken from the U. S. S. Pickaway, the ship that carried General Frank E. Lowe (not pictured) into Inchon during the Korean War.

title: Convoy at sea during Korean War
Scopenote: View of the American convoy at sea, taken from the U.S.S. Pickaway, showing ships carrying troops out of Japan.

title: General Frank E. Lowe and Captain Samuel H. Crittenden during Korean War
Scopenote: General Frank E. Lowe and Captain Samuel H. Crittenden observe the activities on Wolmi Do Island from the U. S. S. Pickaway in Inchon Harbor during the Korean War.

title: General Frank E. Lowe during Korean War
Scopenote: General Frank E. Lowe observing the Marines landing on Wolmi Do Island from the U.S.S. Pickaway in Inchon Harbor during the Korean War.

title: A farm hand and child on the Truman farm in Grandview, Missouri
Scopenote: A farm hand and child pose in the doorway of an outbuilding on the Truman farm in Grandview, Missouri.  (Original negative included)  From:  Fred Truman.

title: Inchon Harbor during Korean War
Scopenote: General Frank E. Lowe (not in picture) sails into the Inchon Harbor aboard the U. S. S. Pickaway, with ships in single file, without incident.

title: Ships anchored in Inchon Harbor
Scopenote: Ships already anchored in Inchon Harbor.  The smoky haze on the left is Inchon burning.  We were going through a very narrow channel at the time.  These are the observations of General Frank E. Lowe (not pictured) from aboard the U. S. S. Pickaway.

title: South Korean Marines going down cargo nets into L.C.V.P. during Korean War
Scopenote: South Korean Marines going down cargo nets into an L.C.V.P. which carried them into Inchon during the Korean War.  No one was hurt during the debarkation.  United States Navy Officers and men performed their duties in a superior manner.  Photo taken from aboard the U. S. S. Pickaway.

title: South Korean Marines go into the L.C.V.P. during Korean War
Scopenote: South Korean Marines go into the L.C.V.P. during the Korean War. Note the sign in the boat.  "15" signifies the wave number and "8" signifies the position the boat will fill, in the wave.  Photo taken from aboard the U.S.S. Pickaway in Inchon, Korea.

title: Korean Marines during Inchon assault
Scopenote: South Korean Marines all loaded and ready for the assault on Inchon. Taken from aboard the U. S. S. Pickaway, Inchon, Korea.

title: Loaded L.C.V.P.'s during Korean War
Scopenote: The L.C.V.P.'s all loaded, shove off and take their positions for the assault on Inchon during the Korean War.  Photo taken from aboard U.S.S. Pickaway near Inchon.

title: The L.C.V.P.'s return to the ship during Korean War
Scopenote: The L.C.V.P.'s return to the ship for more troops or cargo during the Korean War.  This photo was taken from U.S.S. Pickaway near Inchon.

title: Departing L.S.T. during Korean War
Scopenote: A departing L.S.T. extends passing courtesy to U.S.S. Pickaway during Korean War.

title: Damaged L.C.V.P. during Korean War
Scopenote: One of our L.C.V.P.'s returns to the ship with the ramp badly damaged.  This L.C.V.P. was one of the first to land on Wolmi Do Island.  Photo taken from aboard the U.S.S. Pickaway in Inchon Harbor during battle of Inchon.

title: View of ship in convoy during Korean War
Scopenote: A view of a sister ship in our convoy during Korean War. L.C.V.P.'s in the center are circling and waiting their turn to be loaded.  Taken from aboard the U.S.S. Pickaway, Inchon, Korea.

title: An unidentified boy and horse on the Truman farm in Grandview, Missouri
Scopenote: An unidentified young boy poses on his horse in front of a barn on the Truman farm in Grandview, Missouri.  (Original negative included)  From:  Fred Truman.

title: L.S.T. has trouble during Korean War battle of Inchon
Scopenote: An L.S.T. has trouble with their screw propellor.  A C.P.O. from the U.S.S. Pickaway volunteered to repair it, and did! These photos were taken during battle of Inchon.

title: Smoke rises over Inchon during Korean War
Scopenote: The smoke rises over Inchon, as destroyers and cruisers release salvo after salvo of 8-inch shells.  Photo taken from aboard the U. S. S. Pickaway in Inchon Harbor.

title: L.C.V.P.'s return to ship during Korean War battle in Inchon
Scopenote: The L.C.V.P.'s continue to return to the ship and reload for another trip into the newly established beachhead during Korean War battle in Inchon.  Note the smoke over Inchon.  Taken from aboard the U.S.S. Pickaway in Inchon Harbor.

title: U. S. S. Mount McKinley during Korean War
Scopenote: The U. S. S. Mount McKinley, General Douglas MacArthur's flagship.  Photo taken from the U. S. S. Pickaway in Inchon Harbor.

title: Light cruiser firing on Inchon during Korean War
Scopenote: A light cruiser firing on Inchon during the Korean War.  Taken from aboard the U.S.S. Pickaway.

title: Sinking Korean Junk, during Korean War
Scopenote: A Korean Junk sinking from bullet holes during the Korean War.  Taken from aboard the U.S.S. Pickaway in Inchon Harbor.

title: Lieutenant Junior Grade E. Peterson and Lieutenant Junior Grade R. W. Maher, Doctors in Korea
Scopenote: Left to right:  Lieutenant Junior Grade E. Peterson and Lieutenant Junior Grade R. W. Maher.  Lieutenant Peterson is holding the projectile the two doctors had just removed from a young marine's brain.  It appeared to be a "dum dum" bullet.  Aboard the U.S.S. Pickaway, Inchon, Korea.

title: Lieutenant E. Peterson holding projectile
Scopenote: Lieutenant E. Peterson holding the projectile he had just removed from a marine's brain. Aboard the U.S.S. Pickaway, Inchon, Korea.

title: Captain A. G. Hume and General Frank E. Lowe during the Korean War
Scopenote: Captain A. G. Hume and General Frank E. Lowe and our Jeep headed for the shores of Wolmi Do Island.

title: The U.S.S. Mount McKinley, flagship of General MacArthur, during Korean War
Scopenote: General Douglas MacArthur's flagship, the U.S.S. Mount McKinley enroute to Wolmi Do Island during the Korean War.

title: A young woman and child pet a horse on the Truman farm in Grandview, Missouri
Scopenote: An unidentified young woman introduces a child to a horse tied to a fence on the Truman farm in Grandview, Missouri.  A farm hand watches in the background.  Through the trees can be seen the Truman farm home.  (Original negative included)  From:  Fred Truman.

title: The U.S.S. Mount McKinley during Korean War
Scopenote: Sideview of the U.S.S. Mount McKinley, flagship of General Douglas MacArthur, enroute to Wolmi Do Island during Korean War.

title: The U. S. S. Mount McKinley during the Korean War
Scopenote: The U. S. S. Mount McKinley, flagship of General Douglas MacArthur, enroute to Wolmi Do Island during Korean War.

title: Green Beach, Wolmi Do Island, during Korean War
Scopenote: Green Beach, Wolmi Do Island,  "We landed here at 1230 hours" during Korean War.

title: Major General O. P. Smith, Major General Frank E. Lowe and Brigadier General E. A. Craig in Inchon, Korea
Scopenote: From left to right:  Major General Oliver P. Smith, 1st Marine Division Commander; Major General Frank E. Lowe; Brigadier General E. A. Craig, Assistant Division Commander at 1st Marine Division C. P., Inchon, Korea.

title: Ruins of Inchon caused by Naval gunfire
Scopenote: Ruins of Inchon caused by Naval gunfire during Korean War.

title: Command Post of South Korean Marines during Korean War
Scopenote: Command Post of South Korean Marines, Galley 6, Inchon, Korea.

title: Enemy T-34 tanks during Korean War
Scopenote: Two enemy T-34 tanks on the Inchon-Seoul Road, 1st Marine Sector, during the Korean War.  Ascom City is in the background.

title: North Korean prisoners during Korean War
Scopenote: A group of North Koreans captured by 1st Marine Regiment along the Inchon-Seoul Road.  Most of the prisoners had been in the army less than 30 days.  Near Souza, Korea.

title: Enemy supply dump during Korean War
Scopenote: An enemy supply dump during the Korean War, showing T.N.T. blasting caps and detonating wire, all American made, from Atlas Powder Company, Wilmington, Delaware.  Photo taken near Souza, Korea.

title: Enemy front lines near Souza during Korean War
Scopenote: Enemy front lines located along railroad tracks, "E" Company, 1st Marines Sector, near Souza, Korea.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman, Mrs. Clyde Kimbrough and an unidentified woman at Fort Lewis, Washington
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) shakes hands with Mrs. Clyde Kimbrough, wife of the principal civilian Post Engineer at Fort Lewis, Washington.  The other woman is unidentified.  Mr. Truman was in Seattle, Washington, to attend the Democratic party's annual Jefferson-Jackson Day banquet.  Donor:  Major General Louis W. Truman.

title: A young boy sits on the lap of Fred Truman while a young woman looks on
Scopenote: An unidentified young boy sits on the lap of an older Fred Truman (nephew of President Truman) while a young woman looks on. (Original negative included). The date and location are unknown. From: Fred Truman.

title: General Frank E. Lowe observing the front lines during Korean War
Scopenote: General Frank E. Lowe observing the front lines during the Korean War.  The lead tank of the attacking force is in the background.  Note enemy truck overturned.  Near Souza, Korea.

title: Sergeant First Class Diala During Korean War
Scopenote: Sergeant First Class Diala firing 50 caliber machine gun on enemy target from jeep, supporting the advance of "E" Company, 1st Marines.  Near Souza, Korea.

title: North Korean tanks during Korean War
Scopenote: Two enemy Model T-34 tanks, hidden in valley along the Inchon-Seoul Road, were knocked out by a 3.5 rocket team.  Near Ascom City, Korea.

title: North Korean T-34 tank on fire during Korean War
Scopenote: A North Korean T-34 tank on fire during the Korean War.  Crew members dead on top of tank.  Near Ascom City, Korea.

title: T-34 tank during Korean War
Scopenote: A T-34 Tank hidden between two buildings with gun pointing down Inchon-Seoul Road.  Put out of action by a Marine 3.5 Rocket Team.  Sang gang ni, Korea.

title: Heavy artillery at use during Korean War
Scopenote: A 155 MM Howitzer crew keeps up a steady barrage to slow the enemy advance during the Korean War.

title: Combat Cameraman
Scopenote: Signal Corps photographer Lieutenant Frank Winslow operates motion picture camera near the front.

title: Naval bombardment during Korean War
Scopenote: Eight inch guns of the U.S.S. Toledo fire on military targets on the East Korean coast during the Korean War.

title: Capture of North Korean soldier
Scopenote: A North Korean soldier in white peasant garb is captured as he attempts to infiltrate our lines during the Korean War.

title: Taejon falls during Korean War
Scopenote: Bitter street fighting marked the 24th Infantry Division's withdrawal from Taejon in Korea on July 21, 1950.  Major General William F. Dean, the Division Commander, was lost in the action.

title: A young boy on a horse enters a barn on the Truman farm in Grandview, Missouri
Scopenote: An unidentified boy riding a horse follows an unidentified man into a barn situated on the Truman farm in Grandview, Missouri. (Original negative included)  From:  Fred Truman.

title: Machine gun crew during Korean War
Scopenote: This machine gun crew of African American soldiers in the Korean War beat off a fierce night attack with their accurate firing.

title: Eighth Army Commander Lieutenant General Walton H. Walker
Scopenote: Eighth Army Commander Lieutenant General Walton H. Walker arrives to take charge of the ground operations. He is looking at a map, surrounded by officers.

title: The 25th Infantry Division prepares to go to Korean War from Japan
Scopenote: Men and guns of the 25th Infantry Division load at Japanese ports for the short voyage to Korea to fight in the Korean War.

title: Soldier holding rifle, kneeling in field during Korean War
Scopenote: Sergeant First Class Hun Toon, a 52 year old veteran of both world wars, typified the determination of old and young soldiers alike to make the enemy pay dearly for every foot of ground gained during the Korean War.

title: North Korean prisoners of war at Inchon
Scopenote: Hundreds of North Korean prisoners of war are marched to enclosures at Inchon.

title: Marine inspects downed aircraft during Korean War
Scopenote: Looking for possible snipers, a Marine cautiously inspects a Yak fighter which was destroyed by previous aerial attacks during the Korean War battle in which Kimpo was retaken.

title: Front line aid station during Korean War
Scopenote: Wounded men of the 25th Infantry Division receive emergency treatment before evacuation to rear areas during the Korean War.

title: Chaplain comforting the wounded during Korean War
Scopenote: A First Cavalry Division chaplain gives water to a wounded soldier at an aid station in Kumchon during the Korean War.

title: British troops in action during Korean War
Scopenote: Swashing north beyond captured Pyongyang, men of the 27th British Commonwealth Brigade attack an enemy held village during the Korean War.

title: Eighth Army Units race north
Scopenote: The 24th Infantry Division of the Eighth Army enters Taejon on 28 September, returning to the scene of their earlier battles.

title: A Christmas reunion of the family of J. Vivian Truman
Scopenote: The family of former President Harry S. Truman's brother, J. Vivian Truman (standing at right), gathered in an unidentified home for a Christmas picture.  Others in the photo are unidentified.   From:  Fred Truman.

title: Men of 7th Cavalry Division and the Eighth Army link up near Suwon during Korean War
Scopenote: Men of the 7th Infantry and 1st Cavalry Division exchange insignia symbolizing the union of forces from X Corps and the Eighth Army near Suwon during the Korean War.

title: The Seventh Infantry Division pushes south during Korean War
Scopenote: As one part of the Seventh Infantry Division crosses the Han into Seoul, the 31st Regiment swings south toward Suwon and the advancing United States Eighth Army.  This was taken during the Korean War.

title: Wake Island meeting with Truman and MacArthur
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and General Douglas MacArthur meet for the first time at Wake Island.

title: North Korean civilians push cart down railroad tracks during Korean War
Scopenote: Heading down the rails for Hungnam, these North Korean civilians provide their own motive power on the railroad tracks during the Korean War.

title: Infantryman with rifle on outlook during Korean War
Scopenote: An infantryman from the 3rd Division mans a 75 MM recoilless rifle as part of the rear guard action covering the X Corps evacuation operation during the Korean War.

title: United States Marines arrive at Pusan during Korean War
Scopenote: A welcoming color guard greets members of the First Marine Division at Pusan during Korean War.

title: A policeman searches a refugee's pack during the Korean War
Scopenote: A policeman searches a refugee's pack for concealed arms or ammunition during the Korean War.

title: Tankers guard convoy routes during Korean War
Scopenote: Armored units of the 24th Infantry Division guard convoy routes in the Eighth Army Sector during the Korean War.

title: Refugees flee aboard a train during the Korean War
Scopenote: Refugees swarm aboard a locomotive at Sariwon as they attempt to flee the area during the Korean War.

title: Elements of the First Marine Division escape from encirclement during Korean War
Scopenote: Elements of the 1st Marine Division link up with other X Corps forces after fighting their way from the Chosin Reservoir area toward Hamhung during the Korean War.

title: Members of the family of J. Vivian Truman at a Christmas reunion
Scopenote: Unidentified members of the family of former President Harry S. Truman's brother, J. Vivian Truman, pose for a photo on a sofa at a Christmas reunion in an unidentified home.  See also 2007-72. (Original negative)  Donor:  Fred Truman.

title: Third Division combat patrol during Korean War
Scopenote: Troops of the 3rd Division move out to join forces with encircled marines and army units during the Korean War.

title: A machine gun crew in action during Korean War
Scopenote: A machine gun crew from an ambushed convoy goes into action in the 3rd Division sector during the Korean War.

title: Hospital train during Korean War
Scopenote: Wounded men receive treatment on a train enroute to hospitals during the Korean War.

title: Troops on road south of Pyongyang during Korean War
Scopenote: A general withdrawal of troops, seen on a dusty road south of Pyongyang during Korean War.

title: A convoy is ambushed by Chinese forces during the Korean War
Scopenote: A 3rd Infantry Division convoy is ambushed by Chinese forces during the Korean War.

title: Refugees flee Pyongyang during Korean War
Scopenote: Thousands of civilians brave the icy waters of the Taedong River as they head southward from Pyongyang to escape the advancing Communist forces during the Korean War.

title: Enemy soldiers surrendering to Marines during Korean War
Scopenote: Cleanup on Wolmi.  Overcome by the swift and powerful invasion, these holed-up enemy soldiers surrender to the Marine attack force during the Korean War.

title: Korean War soldiers in defensive line behind the Naktong River
Scopenote: Behind the natural barrier of the Naktong River, United Nations forces dig in on a firm defensive perimeter during the Korean War.

title: Sunday Mass during Korean War
Scopenote: With the din of battle only a half mile away, these Korean War soldiers pause to receive communion during mass.

title: Korean War soldiers with 75mm recoilless rifles
Scopenote: The 75 MM recoilless rifle is an effective infantry weapon for Korean War soldiers.

title: President Truman and his sister, Mary Jane, at airport in Springfield, Missouri
Scopenote: Badly faded snapshot of President Harry S. Truman speaking with his sister, Mary Jane, at an airport in Springfield, Missouri, where he will attend a 35th Division reunion. From: Mrs. Ralph E. Truman, Springfield, Missouri.

title: United States troops reach border of Manchuria during Korean War
Scopenote: Members of the 17th Regiment, 7th Infantry Division, enter Hyesanjin, on Manchurian border on November 21, 1950, during the Korean War.

title: Airlift in operation during Korean War
Scopenote: Kimpo's runways were in excellent condition and Air Force transport planes began bringing in men and supplies during the Korean War.

title: Marksman at the Han during Korean War
Scopenote: With Seoul and its' knocked-out bridges over the Han River in the background, this Marine draws a bead on the withdrawing enemy during the Korean War.

title: Major General Edward M. Almond and his aide confer with General Frank E. Lowe during Korean War
Scopenote: Major General Edward M. Almond, CG X Corps, and his aide, Captain Ladd, confer with Major General Frank E. Lowe, Military Advisor to President Harry S. Truman, at the Kimpo Air Base during the Korean War.

title: General Frank E. Lowe and other officers during Korean War
Scopenote: Left to right:  Colonel Jeter, G-3 Officer; an unidentified officer; Brigadier General Van Brunt, of I Corps and Major General Frank E. Lowe, Advisor to the President, confer somewhere in Korea.

title: United Nations Forces escape trap during Korean War
Scopenote: Convoys move toward Pyongyang as part of a general withdrawal after United Nation's attacks disclosed the presence of overwhelmingly large Chinese forces, during the Korean War. Refugees can be seen in the fields.

title: Amphibious operation during Korean War
Scopenote: Troops of the 1st Cavalry Division come ashore at Pohang-Dong on 18 July, during the Korean War.

title: The big bazooka, Korean War
Scopenote: Infantrymen fire the 3.5" rocket during the Korean War, highly effective against enemy.

title: Heavy Marine tanks during Korean War
Scopenote: The Marines move toward the front at once, in the Korean War, to assist in stabilizing the United Nations line.

title: Carriers in action during Korean War
Scopenote: A Navy Corsair leaves the flight deck of the U. S. S. Philippine Sea as the tempo of the air offensive increased. This was taken during the Korean War.

title: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with Mrs. Ralph E. Truman at a Springfield, Missouri airport
Scopenote: Badly faded snapshot of President Harry S. Truman shaking hands with Mrs. Ralph E. Truman (Olive), wife of the President's cousin, at an airport in Springfield, Missouri, where he will attend a 35th Division reunion.  From:  Mrs. Ralph E. Truman

title: President Truman and Vice President Barkley in Inaugural Parade with Battery D Members
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley (in car) were escorted by an honor guard of Battery D of the 35th Division on Pennsylvania Avenue during the inaugural parade. Battery D was President Truman's World War I battery.

title: Battery D accompanying presidential limousine at beginning of Inaugural Parade
Scopenote: Members of Battery D of the 129th Field Artillery flank the Presidential car with President Harry S. Truman and Vice President Alben Barkley as the parade forms east of the Capitol Building.

title: Lorain Cunningham stands next to a portrait of President Truman
Scopenote: Lorain H. Cunningham stands next to a portrait of President Harry S. Truman. Mr. Cunningham was a member of Battery D of the 35th Division in World War I.

title: Mr. Fields and Mr. Masterson of 129th Field Artillery at Fort Riley
Scopenote: Snapshot showing Mr. Fields and Mr. Cunningham of 129th Field Artillery training at Fort Riley, Kansas. From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Fort Riley, Kansas
Scopenote: Snapshot of Fort Riley, Kansas. From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham taken during training for the 129th Field Artillery during World War I.

title: Unknown Soldier at Fort Riley, Kansas
Scopenote: Snapshot of an unknown soldier at Fort Riley, Kansas. From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham taken during training for the 129th Field Artillery at Fort Riley, Kansas.

title: Soldiers at Fort Riley
Scopenote: Snapshot of three unknown soldiers at Fort Riley, Kansas. From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I, taken during training at Fort Riley, Kansas.

title: Second Lieutenant Lorain Cunningham, Full-Length
Scopenote: Snapshot of Second Lieutenant Lorain Cunningham taken during Officers Training Camp at Fort Riley, Kansas for 129th Field Artillery in World War 1. Duplicate of 2007-810. From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Second Lieutenant Lorain Cunningham and Mr. Beebe at Fort Riley
Scopenote: Snapshot of Second Lieutenant Lorain Cunningham (left) and Mr. Beebe during training at Fort Riley, Kansas during World War I. From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: 2nd Lieutenant Lorain H. Cunningham
Scopenote: Snapshot of Lorain H. Cunningham taken during training at Fort Riley, Kansas during World War I. Lorain H. Cunningham served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman, Mary Jane Truman, and unidentified others at an airport in Springfield, Missouri
Scopenote: Badly faded snapshot of President Harry S. Truman speaking with his sister, Mary Jane Truman (center) and two unidentified women at an airport in Springfield, Missouri, where he will attend a 35th Division Reunion.  From:  Mrs. Ralph E. Truman

title: This Building First Capitol, Territory of Kansas
Scopenote: Snapshot of unknown soldier standing in door of First Capitol, Territory of Kansas (possibly Lecompton, Kansas?). From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham taken during training of 129th Field Artillery at Fort Riley, Kansas during World War I.

title: Second Lt. Lorain Cunningham and Mr. Beebe at Fort Riley
Scopenote: Second Lieutenant Lorain Cunningham (left) and Mr. Beebe during training at Fort Riley, Kansas during World War I. From an album by Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Trench Construction at Fort Riley
Scopenote: Snapshot of trench construction during training for the 129th Field Artillery at Fort Riley, Kansas.    From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Trench Construction at Fort Riley
Scopenote: Snapshot of soldiers doing trench construction during training of 129th Field Artillery at Fort Riley. From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Trench construction at Fort Riley
Scopenote: Snapshot of soldiers during training on trench construction for the 129th Field Artillery at Fort Riley, Kansas. From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Snapshot of Shadow on Brick Area with Caption "Coming Events"
Scopenote: Snapshot of shadow on brick wall, labeled "Coming Events," taken during training of 129th Field Artillery at Fort Riley, Kansas. From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Soldiers and Horses at Camp Funston
Scopenote: Snapshot of 129th Field Artillery training at Camp Funston (Oklahoma) during World War I. From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Training of 129th Field Artillery at Fort Riley
Scopenote: Snapshot of 129th Field Artillery during training at Fort Riley. From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Training at Fort Riley for 129th F. A
Scopenote: Snapshot of 129th Field Artillery during training at Fort Riley, Kansas.    From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Lorain Cunningham in Tent Entrance at Camp Cody, New Mexico
Scopenote: Snapshot of Lorain Cunningham at Camp Cody with the caption "Home".    From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: President Harry S. Truman shakes hands with an unidentified man at an airport in Springfield, Missouri
Scopenote: A badly faded snapshot of President Harry S. Truman shaking hands with an unidentified man at an airport in Springfield, Missouri, where he will attend a 35th Division reunion.  Mr. Truman is at left.  From:  Mrs. Ralph E. Truman

title: Mr. Dehn at Camp Cody
Scopenote: Snapshot of a soldier, Mr. Dehn, taken at Camp Cody, New Mexico, during training of the 129th Field Artillery.    From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Lieutenant D. L. Tice of 34th Division

title: Presentation of Helmet to the War Memorial Museum of Virginia

title: An aeroplane picture of the old front just east of Verdun
Scopenote: Aerial view of Verdun during World War One.  "An aeroplane picture of the old front just east of Verdun. These pictures were furnished to our Brigade Commander and he assigned parts of the front to each Regimental Commander. Our part was just to the left of the little town shown in the lower part of the picture. The long white ribbon like streak is a rock road. The trenches marked (a) can be easily seen. The shadow like mark (b) in front of the trenches is the barb wire entanglement. A machine pit (c) has been shelled. The many dots on the picture are shell holes."   From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery in World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

A sign on the table reads:  Baked by Denney's Bakery, Westville, Ill.   From:  Harry S. Truman Democratic Club, Danville, Illinois.

Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Where we left 8 of our men from Battery C in Charpentry, France
Scopenote: Where we left 8 of our men, from Battery C, Charpentry, France, during World War One. It is evidently a cemetery amid the ruins of the town. From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War One and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Part of the Protecting System of Forts Surrounding Verdun
Scopenote: Part of the protecting system of forts surrounding Verdun.  It was in this territory that the Crown Prince of Germany made his big drive to take Paris.  This territory was taken and retaken four times.  The great amount of shell fire that practically turned up every foot of ground can be seen from the many holes in the picture.   From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Two soldiers Standing on Railroad Track
Scopenote: Two soldiers standing on railroad track near damage from shell fire, in France.    From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Battle Front Area in France Where Boot was Found with Foot Still Inside
Scopenote: Before the war this place was heavily wooded.  Very few tree stumps can be recognized in the picture.  Quite a few bodies were still unburied when we took these shots.  Near this place I happened to need a shoe string and saw a shoe near a shell hole so I made a grab for the shoe but turned it loose as it still had a foot in it.  Location is in France.  From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Soldier on top of Fort Douaumont near Verdun
Scopenote: Soldier "on top of Fort Douaumont. The condition of the reinforced concrete will give you an idea of the terrible amount of shell fire this fort stood. There are four stories below the ground level and at one time during the Crown Prince's drive, the Germans captured the two upper stories but the French held the two lower ones. We went through this and saw the bullet scarred passageways." From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: French prisoners
Scopenote: After the Armistice was signed many French prisoners of war were turned loose near Verdun to shift for themselves.  There were quite a few around our billets and we tried to feed as many as we could.  Some of them were pretty well discouraged with their homes gone, families scattered and not knowing what the future held for them.   From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham, who served in the 129th Field Artillery during World War I and was a friend of Harry S. Truman.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman and Col. Riffle in the Truman Library parking lot for the 10th anniversary celebration of Richards-Gebaur AFB
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman talks with Col. John A. Riffle, USAF President, Richards-Gebaur Base Community Council, in the parking lot at the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence awaiting the release of several thousand balloons advertising the 10th Anniversary celebration of the founding of Richards-Gebaur Air Base. They are standing in front of a car with a sign which reads:  "Grand Prize - compliments of DeBacker-Weidemier."  From:  Col. John A. Riffle.

title: U.S.N.T. Zeppelin

title: U.S.N.T. Zeppelin
Scopenote: U.S.N.T. Zeppelin.  Mr. Cunningham identified the photograph: "This is the ship we came home on.  It was a German liner until the Armistice was signed."  Harry S. Truman also returned on the Zeppelin.  From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham.

title: Soldiers returning home from World War One on the ship Zeppelin
Scopenote: On our way home.  Soldiers returning home from World War One on the ship Zeppelin, which is the ship on which both Lorain H. Cunningham and Harry S. Truman returned. These soldiers are unidentified.  From an album of Lorain H. Cunningham.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman and Col. Riffle in the Truman Library parking lot for the 10th anniversary celebration of Richards-Gebaur AFB
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman talks with Col. John A. Riffle, USAF President, Richards-Gebaur Base Community Council, on the parking lot at the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence, awaiting the release of several thousand balloons advertising the 10th anniversary celebration of the founding of Richards-Gebaur Air Base.  The children in the photo are unidentified.  The photo is autographed as follows:  "Kindest regards to Colonel John Riffle from Harry S. Truman - 2-7-64."  From:  Col. John A. Riffle.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman, Col. Riffle, A1C Gerald Ingram and Mrs. Ingram at the Truman Library
Scopenote: Col. John A. Riffle, Chairman, Richards-Gebaur Base Community Council, presents Airman First Class Gerald L. Ingram with a certificate naming him as Airman of the Year for 1963 at Richards-Gebaur Air Force Base at the Harry S. Truman Library in Independence.  Left to right are:  Col. Riffle, A1C Ingram, former President Truman, Mrs. Beverly Ingram, and two unidentified men.  The party met with the former President and were taken on a tour of the Library by Milton Perry, Curator (not pictured).  From:  Col. John A. Riffle.
